FORMAT.descriptionText: Returns a formatted string, with substitutions applied.

GET_INITIALS.name: apex_string.get_initials
GET_INITIALS.bodyFullText:
get_initials (
   p_str in varchar2,
   p_cnt in number default 2 )
   return varchar2
GET_INITIALS.descriptionText: Get N letter initials from the first N words.

GREP.name: apex_string.grep
GREP.body:
p_table => $1
	, p_pattern => $2
	, p_modifier => null
	, p_subexpression => '0'
	, p_limit => null
GREP.bodyFullText:
grep (
   p_table         in apex_t_varchar2,
   p_pattern       in varchar2,
   p_modifier      in varchar2    default null,
   p_subexpression in varchar2    default '0',
   p_limit         in pls_integer default null )
   return apex_t_varchar2;
GREP.descriptionText: Returns the values of the input table that match a regular expression.

JOIN.name: apex_string.join
JOIN.bodyFullText:
join (
   p_table in apex_t_varchar2,
   p_sep in varchar2 default apex_application.LF)
   return varchar2
JOIN.descriptionText: Returns the values of the apex_t_varchar2 input table p_table as a concatenated varchar2, separated by p_sep.

JOIN_CLOB.name: apex_string.join_clob
JOIN_CLOB.bodyFullText:
join_clob (
    p_table in apex_t_varchar2,
    p_sep   in varchar2    default apex_application.LF,
    p_dur   in pls_integer default sys.dbms_lob.call )
    return clob
JOIN_CLOB.descriptionText: Returns the values of the apex_t_varchar2 input table p_table as a concatenated clob, separated by p_sep.

PLIST_DELETE.name: apex_string.plist_delete
PLIST_DELETE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the property list key from the table, by setting it to null.

PLIST_GET.name: apex_string.plist_get
PLIST_GET.bodyFullText:
plist_get (
     p_table in apex_t_varchar2,
     p_key in varchar2 )
     return varchar2
PLIST_GET.descriptionText: This function gets the property list value for a key.

PLIST_PUT.name: apex_string.plist_put
PLIST_PUT.bodyFullText:
plist_put (
     p_table in out nocopy apex_t_varchar2,
     p_key   in varchar2,
     p_value in varchar2 );
PLIST_PUT.descriptionText: This function inserts or updates property list value for a key.

PUSH.name: apex_string.push
PUSH.descriptionText: This procedure appends value to apex_t_varchar2 table.

SHUFFLE.name: apex_string.shuffle
SHUFFLE.descriptionText: Returns the input table values, re-ordered.

SPLIT.name: apex_string.split
SPLIT.bodyFullText:
split (
    p_str   in varchar2,
    p_sep   in varchar2 default apex_application.LF,
    p_limit in pls_integer default null )
    return apex_t_varchar2;
SPLIT.descriptionText: Use this function to split input string at separator.

SPLIT_NUMBERS.name: apex_string.split_numbers
SPLIT_NUMBERS.bodyFullText:
split_numbers (
     p_str in varchar2,
     p_sep in varchar2 default apex_application.LF )
     return apex_t_number;
SPLIT_NUMBERS.descriptionText: Use this function to split input at separator, values must all be numbers.

CLEAR_ALL_USERS_STYLE.name: apex_theme.clear_all_users_style
CLEAR_ALL_USERS_STYLE.body:
p_application_id => {current application id}
	, p_theme_number => {current theme id}
CLEAR_ALL_USERS_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure clears all theme style user preferences for an application and theme.

CLEAR_USER_STYLE.name: apex_theme.clear_user_style
CLEAR_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure clears the theme style user preference for user and application.

DISABLE_USER_STYLE.name: apex_theme.disable_user_style
DISABLE_USER_STYLE.body:
p_application_id => {current application id}
	, p_theme_number => {current theme number}
DISABLE_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure disables theme style selection by end users. End users will not be able to customize the theme style on their own. Note that this only affects the Customization link for end users. APEX_THEME API calls are independent.

ENABLE_USER_STYLE.name: apex_theme.enable_user_style
ENABLE_USER_STYLE.body:
p_application_id => {current application id}
	, p_theme_number => {current theme number}
ENABLE_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure enables theme style selection by end users. When enabled and there is at least one theme style marked as Public, end users will see a Customize link which allows to choose the theme style. End user theme style selection is enabled or disabled at the User Interface level. When providing a theme number, the theme must be the Current Theme for a user interface. Note that this only affects the Customization link for end users. APEX_THEME API calls are independent.

GET_USER_STYLE.name: apex_theme.get_user_style
GET_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This function returns the theme style user preference for the user and application. If no user preference is present, NULL is returned.

SET_CURRENT_STYLE.name: apex_theme.set_current_style
SET_CURRENT_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets current theme style for the current application.

SET_SESSION_STYLE.name: apex_theme.set_session_style
SET_SESSION_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the theme style dynamically for the current session. This is typically being called after successful authentication.

SET_SESSION_STYLE_CSS.name: apex_theme.set_session_style_css
SET_SESSION_STYLE_CSS.descriptionText: This procedure sets the theme style CSS urls dynamically for the current session. Theme style CSS URLs are being directly passed in; a persistent style definition is not needed. This is typically being called after successful authentication.

SET_USER_STYLE.name: apex_theme.set_user_style
SET_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets a theme style user preference for the current user and application. Theme Style User Preferences are automatically picked up and precede any style set with SET_SESSION_STYLE.

ADD_AD_COLUMN.name: apex_ui_default_update.add_ad_column
ADD_AD_COLUMN.body:
p_column_name => $1
	, p_label => NULL
	, p_help_text => NULL
	, p_format_mask => NULL
	, p_default_value => NULL
	, p_form_format_mask => NULL
	, p_form_display_width => NULL
	, p_form_display_height => NULL
	, p_form_data_type => NULL
	, p_report_format_mask => NULL
	, p_report_col_alignment => NULL
	, p_syn_name1 => NULL
	, p_syn_name2 => NULL
	, p_syn_name3 => NULL
ADD_AD_COLUMN.bodyNoDefault:
p_column_name => $1
	, p_label => $2
	, p_help_text => $3
	, p_format_mask => $4
	, p_default_value => $5
	, p_form_format_mask => $6
	, p_form_display_width => $7
	, p_form_display_height => $8
	, p_form_data_type => $9
	, p_report_format_mask => $10
	, p_report_col_alignment => $11
	, p_syn_name1 => $12
	, p_syn_name2 => $13
	, p_syn_name3 => $14
ADD_AD_COLUMN.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.ADD_AD_COLUMN (
    p_column_name           IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_label                 IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_format_mask           IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_format_mask      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_width    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_height   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_data_type        IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_format_mask    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_col_alignment  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name1             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name2             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name3             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
ADD_AD_COLUMN.descriptionText: Adds a User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary entry with the provided definition. Up to three synonyms can be provided during the creation. Additional synonyms can be added post-creation using apex_ui_default_update.add_ad_synonym. Synonyms share the column definition of their base column.

ADD_AD_SYNONYM.name: apex_ui_default_update.add_ad_synonym
ADD_AD_SYNONYM.descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym provided is created and associated with that column. Synonyms share the column definition of their base column.

DEL_AD_COLUMN.name: apex_ui_default_update.del_ad_column
DEL_AD_COLUMN.descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the column, along with any associated synonyms, is deleted.

DEL_AD_SYNONYM.name: apex_ui_default_update.del_ad_synonym
DEL_AD_SYNONYM.descriptionText: If the synonym name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym name is deleted.

DEL_COLUMN.name: apex_ui_default_update.del_column
DEL_COLUMN.descriptionText: If the provided table and column exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it are deleted.

DEL_GROUP.name: apex_ui_default_update.del_group
DEL_GROUP.descriptionText: If the provided table and group exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it are deleted and any column within the table that references that group has the group_id set to null.

DEL_TABLE.name: apex_ui_default_update.del_table
DEL_TABLE.descriptionText: If the provided table exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it is deleted. This includes the deletion of any groups defined for the table and all the columns associated with the table.

SYNCH_TABLE.name: apex_ui_default_update.synch_table
SYNCH_TABLE.descriptionText: If the Table Based User Interface Defaults for the table do not already exist within the use\'s schema, they are defaulted. If they do exist, they are synchronized, meaning, the columns in the table is matched against the column in the UI Defaults Table Definitions. Additions and deletions are used to make them match.

UPD_AD_COLUMN.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_ad_column
UPD_AD_COLUMN.body:
p_column_name => $1
	, p_new_column_name => NULL
	, p_label => NULL
	, p_help_text => NULL
	, p_format_mask => NULL
	, p_default_value => NULL
	, p_form_format_mask => NULL
	, p_form_display_width => NULL
	, p_form_display_height => NULL
	, p_form_data_type => NULL
	, p_report_format_mask => NULL
	, p_report_col_alignment => NULL
UPD_AD_COLUMN.bodyNoDefault:
p_column_name => $1
	, p_new_column_name => $2
	, p_label => $3
	, p_help_text => $4
	, p_format_mask => $5
	, p_default_value => $6
	, p_form_format_mask => $7
	, p_form_display_width => $8
	, p_form_display_height => $9
	, p_form_data_type => $10
	, p_report_format_mask => $11
	, p_report_col_alignment => $12
UPD_AD_COLUMN.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_AD_COLUMN (
    p_column_name           IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_new_column_name       IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_label                 IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_format_mask           IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_format_mask      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_width    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_height   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_data_type        IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_format_mask    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_col_alignment  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_AD_COLUMN.descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the column entry is updated using the provided parameters. If\'null\' is passed in, the value of the associated parameter is set to null.

UPD_AD_SYNONYM.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_ad_synonym
UPD_AD_SYNONYM.descriptionText: If the synonym name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym name is updated.

UPD_COLUMN.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_column
UPD_COLUMN.body:
p_table_name => $1
	, p_column_name => $2
	, p_group_id => NULL
	, p_label => NULL
	, p_help_text => NULL
	, p_display_in_form => NULL
	, p_display_seq_form => NULL
	, p_mask_form => NULL
	, p_default_value => NULL
	, p_required => NULL
	, p_display_width => NULL
	, p_max_width => NULL
	, p_height => NULL
	, p_display_in_report => NULL
	, p_display_seq_report => NULL
	, p_mask_report => NULL
	, p_alignment => NULL
UPD_COLUMN.bodyNoDefault:
p_table_name => $1
	, p_column_name => $2
	, p_group_id => $3
	, p_label => $4
	, p_help_text => $5
	, p_display_in_form => $6
	, p_display_seq_form => $7
	, p_mask_form => $8
	, p_default_value => $9
	, p_required => $10
	, p_display_width => $11
	, p_max_width => $12
	, p_height => $13
	, p_display_in_report => $14
	, p_display_seq_report => $15
	, p_mask_report => $16
	, p_alignment => $17
UPD_COLUMN.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_COLUMN (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_group_id              IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_label                 IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_in_form       IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_seq_form      IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_mask_form             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_required              IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_width         IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_max_width             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_height                IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_in_report     IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_seq_report    IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_mask_report           IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_alignment             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_COLUMN.descriptionText: If the provided table and column exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the provided parameters are updated. If\'null\' is passed in, the value of the associated parameter is set to null.

UPD_DISPLAY_IN_FORM.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_display_in_form
UPD_DISPLAY_IN_FORM.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_DISPLAY_IN_FORM (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_in_form       IN VARCHAR2);
UPD_DISPLAY_IN_FORM.descriptionText: The UPD_DISPLAY_IN_FORM procedure sets the display in form user interface defaults. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table. It controls whether the column is included by default or not.

UPD_DISPLAY_IN_REPORT.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_display_in_report
UPD_DISPLAY_IN_REPORT.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_DISPLAY_IN_REPORT (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_in_report     IN VARCHAR2);
UPD_DISPLAY_IN_REPORT.descriptionText: The UPD_DISPLAY_IN_REPORT procedure sets the display in report user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a report based upon the table and controls whether the column is included by default or not.

UPD_FORM_REGION_TITLE.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_form_region_title
UPD_FORM_REGION_TITLE.descriptionText: The UPD_FORM_REGION_TITLE procedure updates the Form Region Title user interface default. User interface defaults are used in wizards when you create a form based upon the specified table.

UPD_GROUP.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_group
UPD_GROUP.body:
p_table_name => $1
	, p_group_name => $2
	, p_new_group_name => NULL
	, p_description => NULL
	, p_display_sequence => NULL
UPD_GROUP.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_GROUP (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_group_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_new_group_name        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_description           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_sequence      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_GROUP.descriptionText: If the provided table and group exist within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the group name, description and display sequence of the group are updated. If\'null\' is passed in for p_description or p_display_sequence, the value is set to null.

UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_HEIGHT.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_display_height
UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_HEIGHT.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_HEIGHT (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_height        IN NUMBER);
UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_HEIGHT.descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_HEIGHT procedure sets the item display height user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table and include the specified column. Display height controls if the item is a text box or a text area.

UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_WIDTH.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_display_width
UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_WIDTH.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_WIDTH (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_width         IN NUMBER);
UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_WIDTH.descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_WIDTH procedure sets the item display width user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table and include the specified column.

UPD_ITEM_FORMAT_MASK.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_format_mask
UPD_ITEM_FORMAT_MASK.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_FORMAT_MASK (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_format_mask           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_ITEM_FORMAT_MASK.descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_FORMAT_MASK procedure sets the item format mask user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table and include the specified column. Item format mask is typically used to format numbers and dates.

UPD_ITEM_HELP.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_help
UPD_ITEM_HELP.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_HELP (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_help_text             IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_ITEM_HELP.descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_HELP procedure updates the help text for the specified table and column. This user interface default is used when you create a form based upon the table and select to include the specified column.

UPD_LABEL.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_label
UPD_LABEL.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_LABEL (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_label                 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_LABEL.descriptionText: The UPD_LABEL procedure sets the label used for items. This user interface default is used when you create a form or report based on the specified table and include a specific column.

UPD_REPORT_ALIGNMENT.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_report_alignment
UPD_REPORT_ALIGNMENT.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_REPORT_ALIGNMENT (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_report_alignment      IN VARCHAR2);
UPD_REPORT_ALIGNMENT.descriptionText: The UPD_REPORT_ALIGNMENT procedure sets the report alignment user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a report based upon the table and include the specified column and determines if the report column should be left, center, or right justified.

UPD_REPORT_FORMAT_MASK.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_report_format_mask
UPD_REPORT_FORMAT_MASK.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_REPORT_FORMAT_MASK (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_format_mask           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_REPORT_FORMAT_MASK.descriptionText: The UPD_REPORT_FORMAT_MASK procedure sets the report format mask user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a report based upon the table and include the specified column. Report format mask is typically used to format numbers and dates.

UPD_REPORT_REGION_TITLE.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_report_region_title
UPD_REPORT_REGION_TITLE.descriptionText: The UPD_REPORT_REGION_TITLE procedure sets the Report Region Title. User interface defaults are used in wizards when a report is created on a table.

UPD_TABLE.name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_table
UPD_TABLE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_TABLE (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_form_region_title     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_region_title   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_TABLE.descriptionText: If the provided table exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the form region title and report region title are updated to match those provided. If\'null\' is passed in for p_form_region_title or p_report_region_title, the value is set to null.

CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_PAGE_CACHE.name: apex_util.cache_get_date_of_page_cache
CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_PAGE_CACHE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_PAGE_CACHE (
    p_application  IN NUMBER,
    p_page         IN NUMBER)
RETURN DATE;
CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_PAGE_CACHE.descriptionText: This function returns the date and time a specified application page was cached either for the user issuing the call, or for all users if the page was not set to be cached by user.

CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_REGION_CACHE.name: apex_util.cache_get_date_of_region_cache
CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_REGION_CACHE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_REGION_CACHE (
    p_application  IN NUMBER,
    p_page         IN NUMBER,
    p_region_name  IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN DATE;
CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_REGION_CACHE.descriptionText: This function returns the date and time a specified region was cached either for the user issuing the call, or for all users if the page was not set to be cached by user.

CACHE_PURGE_BY_APPLICATION.name: apex_util.cache_purge_by_application
CACHE_PURGE_BY_APPLICATION.descriptionText: This procedure purges all cached pages and regions for a given application.

CACHE_PURGE_BY_PAGE.name: apex_util.cache_purge_by_page
CACHE_PURGE_BY_PAGE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_PURGE_BY_PAGE (
    p_application  IN NUMBER,
    p_page         IN NUMBER,
    p_user_name    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
CACHE_PURGE_BY_PAGE.descriptionText: This procedure purges the cache for a given application and page. If the page itself is not cached but contains one or more cached regions, then the cache for these is also purged.

CACHE_PURGE_STALE.name: apex_util.cache_purge_stale
CACHE_PURGE_STALE.descriptionText: This procedure deletes all cached pages and regions for a specified application that have passed the defined active time period. When you cache a page or region, you specify an active time period (or Cache Timeout). Once that period has passed, the cache is no longer used, thus removing those unusable pages or regions from the cache.

CHANGE_CURRENT_USER_PW.name: apex_util.change_current_user_pw
CHANGE_CURRENT_USER_PW.descriptionText: This procedure changes the password of the currently authenticated user, assuming Application Express user accounts are in use.

CHANGE_PASSWORD_ON_FIRST_USE.name: apex_util.change_password_on_first_use
CHANGE_PASSWORD_ON_FIRST_USE.descriptionText: Enables a developer to check whether this property is enabled or disabled for an end user account. This function returns TRUE if the account password must be changed upon first use (after successful authentication) after the password is initially set and after it is changed on the Administration Service, Edit User page. This function returns FALSE if the account does not have this property.

CLEAR_APP_CACHE.name: apex_util.clear_app_cache
CLEAR_APP_CACHE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CLEAR_APP_CACHE (
    p_app_id    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
CLEAR_APP_CACHE.descriptionText: This procedure removes session state for a given application for the current session.

CLEAR_PAGE_CACHE.name: apex_util.clear_page_cache
CLEAR_PAGE_CACHE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CLEAR_PAGE_CACHE (
    p_page_id IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
CLEAR_PAGE_CACHE.descriptionText: This procedure removes session state for a given page for the current session.

CLEAR_USER_CACHE.name: apex_util.clear_user_cache
CLEAR_USER_CACHE.descriptionText: This procedure removes session state and application system preferences for the current use\'s session. Run this procedure if you reuse session IDs and want to run applications without the benefit of existing session state.

CLOSE_OPEN_DB_LINKS.name: apex_util.close_open_db_links
CLOSE_OPEN_DB_LINKS.descriptionText: This procedure closes all open database links for the current database session. It is rare that this procedure would ever be called programatically in an application. The primary purpose of this procedure is for the middleware technology in an Oracle Application Express environment (for example, Oracle REST Data Service, mod_plsql) to be configured such that it closes all of the open database links in a session, either before a request is made to the Application Express engine, or after a request to the Application Express engine is completed but before the database session is returned to the pool.

COUNT_CLICK.name: apex_util.count_click
COUNT_CLICK.body:
p_url => $1
	, p_cat => $2
	, p_id => NULL
	, p_user => NULL
	, p_workspace => NULL
COUNT_CLICK.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.COUNT_CLICK (
    p_url         IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_cat         IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_id          IN    VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
    p_user        IN    VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
    p_workspace   IN    VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL);
COUNT_CLICK.descriptionText: This procedure counts clicks from an application built in App Builder to an external site. You can also use the shorthand version, procedure Z, in place of APEX_UTIL.COUNT_CLICK.

CREATE_USER_GROUP.name: apex_util.create_user_group

CREATE_USER_GROUP.descriptionText: Assuming you are using Application Express authentication, this procedure creates a user group. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privileges in the workspace.

CURRENT_USER_IN_GROUP.name: apex_util.current_user_in_group
CURRENT_USER_IN_GROUP.descriptionText: This function returns a Boolean result based on whether the current user is a member of the specified group. You can use the group name or group ID to identify the group.

CUSTOM_CALENDAR.name: apex_util.custom_calendar
CUSTOM_CALENDAR.descriptionText: Use this procedure to change the existing calendar view to Custom Calendar.

DELETE_USER_GROUP.name: apex_util.delete_user_group
DELETE_USER_GROUP.descriptionText: Assuming you are using Application Express authentication, this procedure deletes a user group by providing the primary key of the group. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privileges in the workspace.

END_USER_ACCOUNT_DAYS_LEFT.name: apex_util.end_user_account_days_left
END_USER_ACCOUNT_DAYS_LEFT.descriptionText: Returns the number of days remaining before a end user account password expires. This function may be run in a page request context by any authenticated user.

EXPIRE_END_USER_ACCOUNT.name: apex_util.expire_end_user_account
EXPIRE_END_USER_ACCOUNT.descriptionText: Expires the login account for use as a workspace end user. Must be run by an authenticated workspace administrator in a page request context.

EXPIRE_WORKSPACE_ACCOUNT.name: apex_util.expire_workspace_account
EXPIRE_WORKSPACE_ACCOUNT.descriptionText: Expires developer or workspace administrator login accounts. Must be run by an authenticated workspace administrator in a page request context.

EXPORT_USERS.name: apex_util.export_users
EXPORT_USERS.descriptionText: When called from a page, this procedure produces an export file of the current workspace definition, workspace users, and workspace groups. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privilege in the workspace.

FETCH_APP_ITEM.name: apex_util.fetch_app_item
FETCH_APP_ITEM.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.FETCH_APP_ITEM(
    p_item    IN VARCHAR2,
    p_app     IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_session IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
FETCH_APP_ITEM.descriptionText: This function fetches session state for the current or specified application in the current or specified session.

FETCH_USER.descriptionText: This procedure fetches a user account record. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privileges in the workspace. Three overloaded versions of this procedure exist, each with a distinct set of allowed parameters or signatures.

FIND_SECURITY_GROUP_ID.name: apex_util.find_security_group_id
FIND_SECURITY_GROUP_ID.descriptionText: This function returns the numeric security group ID of the named workspace.

FIND_WORKSPACE.name: apex_util.find_workspace
FIND_WORKSPACE.descriptionText: This function returns the workspace name associated with a security group ID.

GET_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_STATUS.name: apex_util.get_account_locked_status
GET_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_STATUS.descriptionText: Returns TRUE if the account is locked and FALSE if the account is unlocked. Must be run by an authenticated workspace administrator in a page request context.

GET_APPLICATION_STATUS.name: apex_util.get_application_status
GET_APPLICATION_STATUS.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_APPLICATION_STATUS(
    p_application_id IN NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_APPLICATION_STATUS.descriptionText: This function returns the current status of the application. Status values include AVAILABLE, AVAILABLE_W_EDIT_LINK, DEVELOPERS_ONLY, RESTRICTED_ACCESS, UNAVAILABLE, UNAVAILABLE_PLSQL, and UNAVAILABLE_URL.

GET_ATTRIBUTE.name: apex_util.get_attribute
GET_ATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_ATTRIBUTE(
    p_username                IN VARCHAR2,
    p_attribute_number        IN NUMBER)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_ATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: This function returns the value of one of the attribute values (1 through 10) of a named user in the Application Express accounts table. Please note these are only accessible by using the APIs.

GET_AUTHENTICATION_RESULT.name: apex_util.get_authentication_result
GET_AUTHENTICATION_RESULT.descriptionText: Use this function to retrieve the authentication result of the current session. Any authenticated user can call this function in a page request context.

GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC.name: apex_util.get_blob_file_src
GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC.body:
p_item_name => NULL
	, p_v1 => NULL
	, p_v2 => NULL
	, p_content_disposition => NULL
GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC (
    p_item_name           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_v1                  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_v2                  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_content_disposition IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC.descriptionText: As an alternative to using the built-in methods of providing a download link, you can use the APEX_UTIL.GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC function. One advantage of this approach, is the ability to more specifically format the display of the image (with height and width tags). Please note that this approach is only valid if called from a valid Oracle Application Express session. Also, this method requires that the parameters that describe the BLOB to be listed as the format of a valid item within the application. That item is then referenced by the function.

GET_BUILD_OPTION_STATUS.name: apex_util.get_build_option_status
GET_BUILD_OPTION_STATUS.descriptionText: Use this function to get the build option status of a specified application by providing the ID of the application build option.

GET_CURRENT_USER_ID.name: apex_util.get_current_user_id
GET_CURRENT_USER_ID.descriptionText: This function returns the numeric user ID of the current user.

GET_DEFAULT_SCHEMA.name: apex_util.get_default_schema
GET_DEFAULT_SCHEMA.descriptionText: This function returns the default schema name associated with the current user.

GET_EDITION.name: apex_util.get_edition
GET_EDITION.descriptionText: This function returns the edition for the current page view.

GET_EMAIL.name: apex_util.get_email
GET_EMAIL.descriptionText: This function returns the email address associated with the named user.

GET_FEEDBACK_FOLLOW_UP.name: apex_util.get_feedback_follow_up
GET_FEEDBACK_FOLLOW_UP.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_FEEDBACK_FOLLOW_UP ( p_feedback_id IN NUMBER, p_row IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1, p_template IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '
#CREATED_ON# (#CREATED_BY#) #FOLLOW_UP#') RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_FEEDBACK_FOLLOW_UP.descriptionText: Use this function to retrieve any remaining follow up associated with a specific feedback.

GET_FILE.name: apex_util.get_file
GET_FILE.descriptionText: This procedure downloads files from the Oracle Application Express file repository. Please note if you are invoking this procedure during page processing, you must ensure that no page branch is invoked under the same condition, as it interferes with the file retrieval. This means that branches with any of the following conditions should not be set to fire:

GET_FILE_ID.name: apex_util.get_file_id
GET_FILE_ID.descriptionText: This function obtains the primary key of a file in the Oracle Application Express file repository.

GET_FIRST_NAME.name: apex_util.get_first_name
GET_FIRST_NAME.descriptionText: This function returns the FIRST_NAME field stored in the named user account record.

GET_GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION.name: apex_util.get_global_notification
GET_GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION(
   p_application_id IN NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION.descriptionText: This function gets the global notification message which is the message displayed in page #GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION# substitution string.

GET_GROUP_ID.name: apex_util.get_group_id
GET_GROUP_ID.descriptionText: This function returns the numeric ID of a named group in the workspace.

GET_GROUP_NAME.name: apex_util.get_group_name
GET_GROUP_NAME.descriptionText: This function returns the name of a group identified by a numeric ID.

GET_GROUPS_USER_BELONGS_TO.name: apex_util.get_groups_user_belongs_to
GET_GROUPS_USER_BELONGS_TO.descriptionText: This function returns a comma then a space separated list of group names to which the named user is a member.

GET_HASH.name: apex_util.get_hash
GET_HASH.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_HASH (
    p_values in apex_t_varchar2,
    p_salted in boolean default true )
    RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_HASH.descriptionText: This function computes a hash value for all given values. Use this function to implement lost update detection for data records.

GET_HIGH_CONTRAST_MODE_TOGGLE.name: apex_util.get_high_contrast_mode_toggle
GET_HIGH_CONTRAST_MODE_TOGGLE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_HIGH_CONTRAST_MODE_TOGGLE (
    p_on_message  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_off_message IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
    RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_HIGH_CONTRAST_MODE_TOGGLE.descriptionText: This function returns a link to the current page that enables you to turn on or off, toggle, the mode. For example, if you are in standard mode, this function displays a link that when clicked switches high contrast mode on.

GET_LAST_NAME.name: apex_util.get_last_name
GET_LAST_NAME.descriptionText: This function returns the LAST_NAME field stored in the named user account record.

GET_NUMERIC_SESSION_STATE.name: apex_util.get_numeric_session_state
GET_NUMERIC_SESSION_STATE.descriptionText: This function returns a numeric value for a numeric item. You can use this function in Oracle Application Express applications wherever you can use PL/SQL or SQL. You can also use the shorthand, function NV, in place of APEX_UTIL.GET_NUMERIC_SESSION_STATE.

GET_PREFERENCE.name: apex_util.get_preference
GET_PREFERENCE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_PREFERENCE (
    p_preference  IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_user        IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT V('USER')) 
RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_PREFERENCE.descriptionText: This function retrieves the value of a previously saved preference for a given user.

GET_PRINT_DOCUMENT.name: apex_util.get_print_document
GET_PRINT_DOCUMENT.body:
p_report_data => $1
	, p_report_layout => $2
	, p_report_layout_type => 'xsl-fo'
	, p_document_format => 'pdf'
	, p_print_server => NULL
GET_PRINT_DOCUMENT.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_PRINT_DOCUMENT (
    p_report_data         IN BLOB,
    p_report_layout       IN CLOB,
    p_report_layout_type  IN VARCHAR2 default 'xsl-fo',
    p_document_format     IN VARCHAR2 default 'pdf',
    p_print_server        IN VARCHAR2 default NULL)
RETURN BLOB;
GET_PRINT_DOCUMENT.descriptionText: This function returns a document as BLOB using XML based report data and RTF or XSL-FO based report layout.

GET_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE.name: apex_util.get_screen_reader_mode_toggle
GET_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE (
    p_on_message  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_off_message IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE.descriptionText: This function returns a link to the current page to turn on or off, toggle, the mode. For example, if you are in standard mode, this function displays a link that when clicked switches screen reader mode on.

GET_SESSION_LANG.name: apex_util.get_session_lang
GET_SESSION_LANG.descriptionText: This function returns the language setting for the current user in the current Application Express session.

GET_SESSION_STATE.name: apex_util.get_session_state
GET_SESSION_STATE.descriptionText: This function returns the value for an item. You can use this function in your Oracle Application Express applications wherever you can use PL/SQL or SQL. You can also use the shorthand, function V, in place of APEX_UTIL.GET_SESSION_STATE.

GET_SESSION_TERRITORY.name: apex_util.get_session_territory
GET_SESSION_TERRITORY.descriptionText: This function returns the territory setting for the current user in the current Application Express session.

GET_SESSION_TIME_ZONE.name: apex_util.get_session_time_zone
GET_SESSION_TIME_ZONE.descriptionText: This function returns the time zone for the current user in the current Application Express session. This value is null if the time zone is not explicitly set by using APEX_UTIL.SET_SESSION_TIME_ZONE or if an applicatio\'s automatic time zone attribute is enabled.

GET_SINCE.name: apex_util.get_since
GET_SINCE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_SINCE (
   p_date  date )
   p_short in [ boolean default false | varchar2 default 'N' ] )  
RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_SINCE.descriptionText: This function returns the relative date in words (for example, 2 days from now, 30 minutes ago). It also accepts a second optional p_short parameter and returns "in 2d", "30m". This function is equivalent to using the SINCE and SINCE_SHORT format mask available within Oracle Application Express and is useful within SQL queries or PL/SQL routines.

GET_SUPPORTING_OBJECT_SCRIPT.name: apex_util.get_supporting_object_script
GET_SUPPORTING_OBJECT_SCRIPT.descriptionText: This function gets supporting object scripts defined in an application.

GET_USER_ID.name: apex_util.get_user_id
GET_USER_ID.descriptionText: This function returns the numeric ID of a named user in the workspace.

GET_USER_ROLES.name: apex_util.get_user_roles
GET_USER_ROLES.descriptionText: This function returns the DEVELOPER_ROLE field stored in the named user account record. Please note that currently this parameter is named inconsistently between the CREATE_USER, EDIT_USER and FETCH_USER APIs, although they all relate to the DEVELOPER_ROLE field. CREATE_USER uses p_developer_privs, EDIT_USER uses p_developer_roles and FETCH_USER uses p_developer_role.

GET_USERNAME.name: apex_util.get_username
GET_USERNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the user name of a user account identified by a numeric ID.

HOST_URL.name: apex_util.host_url
HOST_URL.descriptionText: This function returns the URL to the Application Express instance, depending on the option passed.

HTML_PCT_GRAPH_MASK.name: apex_util.html_pct_graph_mask
HTML_PCT_GRAPH_MASK.body:
p_number => NULL
	, p_size => 100
	, p_background => NULL
	, p_bar_background => NULL
	, p_format => NULL
HTML_PCT_GRAPH_MASK.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.HTML_PCT_GRAPH_MASK (
    p_number         IN NUMBER    DEFAULT NULL,
    p_size           IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
    p_background     IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_bar_background IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_format         IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
HTML_PCT_GRAPH_MASK.descriptionText: Use this function to scale a graph. This function can also be used by classic and interactive reports with format mask of GRAPH. This generates a <div> tag with inline styles.

INCREMENT_CALENDAR.name: apex_util.increment_calendar
INCREMENT_CALENDAR.descriptionText: Use this procedure to navigate to the next set of days in the calendar. Depending on what the calendar view is, this procedure navigates to the next month, week or day. If it is a Custom Calendar the total number of days between the start date and end date are navigated.

IR_CLEAR.name: apex_util.ir_clear

IR_FILTER.name: apex_util.ir_filter
IR_FILTER.body:
p_page_id => $1
	, p_report_column => $2
	, p_operator_abbr => NULL
	, p_filter_value => $3
	, p_report_alias => NULL
IR_FILTER.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.IR_FILTER(
    p_page_id       IN NUMBER,
    p_report_column IN VARCHAR2,
    p_operator_abbr IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_filter_value  IN VARCHAR2,
    p_report_alias  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);

IR_RESET.name: apex_util.ir_reset

IS_HIGH_CONTRAST_SESSION.name: apex_util.is_high_contrast_session
IS_HIGH_CONTRAST_SESSION.descriptionText: This function returns a boolean TRUE if the session is in high contrast mode and returns a boolean FALSE if not in high contrast mode.

IS_HIGH_CONTRAST_SESSION_YN.name: apex_util.is_high_contrast_session_yn
IS_HIGH_CONTRAST_SESSION_YN.descriptionText: This function returns Y if the session is in high contrast mode and N if not in high contrast mode.

IS_LOGIN_PASSWORD_VALID.name: apex_util.is_login_password_valid
IS_LOGIN_PASSWORD_VALID.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.IS_LOGIN_PASSWORD_VALID(
    p_username IN VARCHAR2,
    p_password IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN BOOLEAN;
IS_LOGIN_PASSWORD_VALID.descriptionText: This function returns a Boolean result based on the validity of the password for a named user account in the current workspace. This function returns TRUE if the password matches and it returns FALSE if the password does not match.

IS_SCREEN_READER_SESSION.name: apex_util.is_screen_reader_session
IS_SCREEN_READER_SESSION.descriptionText: This function returns a boolean TRUE if the session is in screen reader mode and returns a boolean FALSE if not in screen reader mode.

IS_SCREEN_READER_SESSION_YN.name: apex_util.is_screen_reader_session_yn
IS_SCREEN_READER_SESSION_YN.descriptionText: This function returns\'\' if the session is in screen reader mode and\'\' if not in screen reader mode.

IS_USERNAME_UNIQUE.name: apex_util.is_username_unique
IS_USERNAME_UNIQUE.descriptionText: This function returns a Boolean result based on whether the named user account is unique in the workspace.

KEYVAL_NUM.name: apex_util.keyval_num
KEYVAL_NUM.descriptionText: This function gets the value of the package variable (apex_utilities.g_val_num) set by APEX_UTIL.SAVEKEY_NUM.

KEYVAL_VC2.name: apex_util.keyval_vc2
KEYVAL_VC2.descriptionText: This function gets the value of the package variable (apex_utilities.g_val_vc2) set by APEX_UTIL.SAVEKEY_VC2.

LOCK_ACCOUNT.name: apex_util.lock_account
LOCK_ACCOUNT.descriptionText: Sets a user account status to locked. Must be run by an authenticated workspace administrator in the context of a page request.

PASSWORD_FIRST_USE_OCCURRED.name: apex_util.password_first_use_occurred
PASSWORD_FIRST_USE_OCCURRED.descriptionText: Returns TRUE if the accoun\'s password has changed since the account was created, an Oracle Application Express administrator performs a password reset operation that results in a new password being emailed to the account holder, or a user has initiated password reset operation. This function returns FALSE if the accoun\'s password has not been changed since either of the events just described.

PREPARE_URL.name: apex_util.prepare_url
PREPARE_URL.body:
p_url => $1
	, p_url_charset => null
	, p_checksum_type => null
	, p_triggering_element => 'this'
PREPARE_URL.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.PREPARE_URL (
    p_url           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_url_charset   IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_checksum_type IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_triggering_element IN VARCHAR2 default 'this')
RETURN VARCHAR2;
PREPARE_URL.descriptionText: The PREPARE_URL function serves two purposes:

PUBLIC_CHECK_AUTHORIZATION.name: apex_util.public_check_authorization

PURGE_REGIONS_BY_APP.name: apex_util.purge_regions_by_app
PURGE_REGIONS_BY_APP.descriptionText: Deletes all cached regions for an application.

PURGE_REGIONS_BY_NAME.name: apex_util.purge_regions_by_name
PURGE_REGIONS_BY_NAME.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.PURGE_REGIONS_BY_NAME (
     p_application IN NUMBER,
     p_page        IN NUMBER,
     p_region_name IN VARCHAR2);
PURGE_REGIONS_BY_NAME.descriptionText: Deletes all cached values for a region identified by the application ID, page number and region name.

PURGE_REGIONS_BY_PAGE.name: apex_util.purge_regions_by_page
PURGE_REGIONS_BY_PAGE.descriptionText: Deletes all cached regions by application and page.

REDIRECT_URL.name: apex_util.redirect_url
REDIRECT_URL.descriptionText: This procedure calls owa_util.redirect_url to tell the browser to redirect to a new URL. Afterwards, it automatically calls apex_application.stop_apex_engine to abort further processing of the Application Express application.

REMOVE_PREFERENCE.name: apex_util.remove_preference
REMOVE_PREFERENCE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the preference for the supplied user.

REMOVE_SORT_PREFERENCES.name: apex_util.remove_sort_preferences
REMOVE_SORT_PREFERENCES.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.REMOVE_SORT_PREFERENCES (
    p_user  IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT V('USER'));
REMOVE_SORT_PREFERENCES.descriptionText: This procedure removes the use\'s column heading sorting preference value.

REMOVE_USER.name: apex_util.remove_user
REMOVE_USER.descriptionText: This procedure removes the user account identified by the primary key or a user name. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privilege in the workspace.

RESET_PASSWORD.name: apex_util.reset_password
RESET_PASSWORD.body:
p_user_name => WWW_FLOW_SECURITY.G_USER
	, p_old_password => NULL
	, p_new_password => $1
	, p_change_password_on_first_use => TRUE
RESET_PASSWORD.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.RESET_PASSWORD (
    p_user_name      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT WWW_FLOW_SECURITY.G_USER,
    p_old_password   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_new_password   IN VARCHAR2,
    p_change_password_on_first_use IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE );
RESET_PASSWORD.descriptionText: This procedure is used to change the password of a given user name for the current workspace. This procedure changes the password of p_user_name in the current workspace to p_new_password. If p_change_password_on_first_use is TRUE, then the user has to change the password on the next login.

RESET_PW.name: apex_util.reset_pw
RESET_PW.descriptionText: This procedure resets the password for a named user and emails it in a message to the email address located for the named account in the current workspace. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privilege in the workspace.

SAVEKEY_NUM.name: apex_util.savekey_num
SAVEKEY_NUM.descriptionText: This function sets a package variable (apex_utilities.g_val_num) so that it can be retrieved using the function KEYVAL_NUM.

SAVEKEY_VC2.name: apex_util.savekey_vc2
SAVEKEY_VC2.descriptionText: This function sets a package variable (apex_utilities.g_val_vc2) so that it can be retrieved using the function KEYVAL_VC2.

SET_APP_BUILD_STAUTS.name: apex_util.set_app_build_stauts
SET_APP_BUILD_STAUTS.bodyFullText:
apex_util.set_app_build_stauts( p_application_id IN NUMBER,
                                p_build_status in VARCHAR2 );
SET_APP_BUILD_STAUTS.descriptionText: This procedure sets the build status of the specified application.

SET_APPLICATION_STATUS.name: apex_util.set_application_status
SET_APPLICATION_STATUS.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.SET_APPLICATION_STATUS(
   p_application_id IN NUMBER,
   p_application_status IN VARCHAR2,
   p_unavailable_value IN VARCHAR2,
   p_restricted_user_list IN VARCHAR2);
SET_APPLICATION_STATUS.descriptionText: This procedure changes the status of the application.

SET_ATTRIBUTE.name: apex_util.set_attribute
SET_ATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.SET_ATTRIBUTE( 
    p_userid           IN NUMBER, 
    p_attribute_number IN NUMBER,
    p_attribute_value  IN VARCHAR2);
SET_ATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the value of one of the attribute values (1 through 10) of a user in the Application Express accounts table.

SET_AUTHENTICATION_RESULT.name: apex_util.set_authentication_result
SET_AUTHENTICATION_RESULT.descriptionText: This procedure can be called from an applicatio\'s custom authentication function (that is, credentials verification function). The status passed to this procedure is logged in the Login Access Log.

SET_BUILD_OPTION_STATUS.name: apex_util.set_build_option_status
SET_BUILD_OPTION_STATUS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to change the build option status of a specified application.

SET_CURRENT_THEME_STYLE.name: apex_util.set_current_theme_style
SET_CURRENT_THEME_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the user interface theme style for an application. For example, if there are more than one theme styles available for the current theme, you can use this procedure to change the application theme style.

SET_CUSTOM_AUTH_STATUS.name: apex_util.set_custom_auth_status
SET_CUSTOM_AUTH_STATUS.descriptionText: This procedure can be called from an applicatio\'s custom authentication function (that is, credentials verification function). The status passed to this procedure is logged in the Login Access Log.

SET_EDITION.name: apex_util.set_edition
SET_EDITION.descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the edition to be used in all application SQL parsed in the current page view or page submission.

SET_EMAIL.name: apex_util.set_email
SET_EMAIL.descriptionText: This procedure updates a user account with a new email address. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privileges in the workspace.

SET_FIRST_NAME.name: apex_util.set_first_name
SET_FIRST_NAME.descriptionText: This procedure updates a user account with a new FIRST_NAME value. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privileges in the workspace.

SET_GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION.name: apex_util.set_global_notification
SET_GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION.descriptionText: This procedure is used to set the global notification message which is the message displayed in page #GLOBAL_NOTIFICATION# substitution string.

SET_GROUP_GROUP_GRANTS.name: apex_util.set_group_group_grants
SET_GROUP_GROUP_GRANTS.descriptionText: This procedure modifies the group grants for a given group.

SET_GROUP_USER_GRANTS.name: apex_util.set_group_user_grants
SET_GROUP_USER_GRANTS.descriptionText: This procedure modifies the group grants for a given user.

SET_LAST_NAME.name: apex_util.set_last_name
SET_LAST_NAME.descriptionText: This procedure updates a user account with a new LAST_NAME value. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privileges in the workspace.

SET_PREFERENCE.name: apex_util.set_preference
SET_PREFERENCE.body:
p_preference => NULL
	, p_value => NULL
	, p_user => NULL
SET_PREFERENCE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.SET_PREFERENCE (
    p_preference   IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_value        IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_user         IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
SET_PREFERENCE.descriptionText: This procedure sets a preference that persists beyond the use\'s current session.

SET_SECURITY_GROUP_ID.name: apex_util.set_security_group_id
SET_SECURITY_GROUP_ID.descriptionText: Use this procedure with apex_util.find_security_group_id to ease the use of the mail package in batch mode. This procedure is especially useful when a schema is associated with more than one workspace. For example, you might want to create a procedure that is run by a nightly job to email all outstanding tasks.

SET_SESSION_HIGH_CONTRAST_OFF.name: apex_util.set_session_high_contrast_off
SET_SESSION_HIGH_CONTRAST_OFF.descriptionText: This procedure switches off high contrast mode for the current session.

SET_SESSION_HIGH_CONTRAST_ON.name: apex_util.set_session_high_contrast_on
SET_SESSION_HIGH_CONTRAST_ON.descriptionText: This procedure switches on high contrast mode for the current session.

SET_SESSION_LANG.name: apex_util.set_session_lang
SET_SESSION_LANG.descriptionText: This procedure sets the language to be used for the current user in the current Application Express session. The language must be a valid IANA language name.

SET_SESSION_LIFETIME_SECONDS.name: apex_util.set_session_lifetime_seconds
SET_SESSION_LIFETIME_SECONDS.descriptionText: This procedure sets the current sessio\'s Maximum Session Length in Seconds value. overriding the corresponding application attribute. This allows developers to dynamically shorten or lengthen the session life based on criteria determined after the user authenticates.

SET_SESSION_MAX_IDLE_SECONDS.name: apex_util.set_session_max_idle_seconds
SET_SESSION_MAX_IDLE_SECONDS.descriptionText: Sets the current applicatio\'s Maximum Session Idle Time in Seconds value for the current session, overriding the corresponding application attribute. This allows developers to dynamically shorten or lengthen the maximum idle time allowed between page requests based on criteria determined after the user authenticates.

SET_SESSION_SCREEN_READER_OFF.name: apex_util.set_session_screen_reader_off
SET_SESSION_SCREEN_READER_OFF.descriptionText: This procedure switches off screen reader mode for the current session.

SET_SESSION_SCREEN_READER_ON.name: apex_util.set_session_screen_reader_on
SET_SESSION_SCREEN_READER_ON.descriptionText: This procedure puts the current session into screen reader mode.

SET_SESSION_STATE.name: apex_util.set_session_state
SET_SESSION_STATE.descriptionText: This procedure sets session state for a current Oracle Application Express session.

SET_SESSION_TERRITORY.name: apex_util.set_session_territory
SET_SESSION_TERRITORY.descriptionText: This procedure sets the territory to be used for the current user in the current Application Express session. The territory name must be a valid Oracle territory.

SET_SESSION_TIME_ZONE.name: apex_util.set_session_time_zone
SET_SESSION_TIME_ZONE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the time zone to be used for the current user in the current Application Express session.

SET_USERNAME.name: apex_util.set_username
SET_USERNAME.descriptionText: This procedure updates a user account with a new USER_NAME value. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privileges in the workspace.

SHOW_HIGH_CONTRAST_MODE_TOGGLE.name: apex_util.show_high_contrast_mode_toggle
SHOW_HIGH_CONTRAST_MODE_TOGGLE.descriptionText: This procedure displays a link to the current page to turn on or off, toggle, the mode. For example, if you are in standard mode, this function displays a link that when clicked switches the high contrast mode on.

SHOW_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE.name: apex_util.show_screen_reader_mode_toggle
SHOW_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.SHOW_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE (
    p_on_message  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_off_message IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
SHOW_SCREEN_READER_MODE_TOGGLE.descriptionText: This procedure displays a link to the current page to turn on or off, toggle, the mode. For example, if you are in standard mode, this function displays a link that when clicked switches the screen reader mode on.

STRING_TO_TABLE.name: apex_util.string_to_table
STRING_TO_TABLE.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.STRING_TO_TABLE (
    p_string       IN VARCHAR2,
    p_separator    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT ':') 
    RETURN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2;
STRING_TO_TABLE.descriptionText: Given a string, this function returns a PL/SQL array of type APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2. This array is a VARCHAR2(32767) table.

p_username => $1

	, p_old_password => $3
	, p_workspace_name => $4
	, p_use_strong_rules => $5
	, p_min_length_err => $6
	, p_new_differs_by_err => $7
	, p_one_alpha_err => $8
	, p_one_numeric_err => $9
	, p_one_punctuation_err => $10
	, p_one_upper_err => $11
	, p_one_lower_err => $12
	, p_not_like_username_err => $13
	, p_not_like_workspace_name_err => $14
	, p_not_like_words_err => $15
	, p_not_reusable_err => $16
STRONG_PASSWORD_CHECK.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.STRONG_PASSWORD_CHECK(
    p_username                    IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_password                    IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_old_password                IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_workspace_name              IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_use_strong_rules            IN  BOOLEAN,
    p_min_length_err              OUT BOOLEAN,

    p_not_like_username_err       OUT BOOLEAN,
    p_not_like_workspace_name_err OUT BOOLEAN,
    p_not_like_words_err          OUT BOOLEAN,
    p_not_reusable_err            OUT BOOLEAN);
STRONG_PASSWORD_CHECK.descriptionText: This procedure returns Boolean OUT values based on whether a proposed password meets the password strength requirements as defined by the Oracle Application Express site administrator.

STRONG_PASSWORD_VALIDATION.name: apex_util.strong_password_validation
STRONG_PASSWORD_VALIDATION.bodyFullText:
STRONG_PASSWORD_VALIDATION(
    p_username                    IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_password                    IN  VARCHAR2,
    P_OLD_PASSWORD                IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    P_WORKSPACE_NAME              IN  VARCHAR2)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
STRONG_PASSWORD_VALIDATION.descriptionText: This function returns formatted HTML in a VARCHAR2 result based on whether a proposed password meets the password strength requirements as defined by the Oracle Application Express site administrator.

SUBMIT_FEEDBACK_FOLLOWUP.name: apex_util.submit_feedback_followup
SUBMIT_FEEDBACK_FOLLOWUP.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.SUBMIT_FEEDBACK_FOLLOWUP (
    p_feedback_id      IN NUMBER,
    p_follow_up        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_email            IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
SUBMIT_FEEDBACK_FOLLOWUP.descriptionText: This procedure enables you to submit follow up to a feedback.

TABLE_TO_STRING.name: apex_util.table_to_string
TABLE_TO_STRING.bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.TABLE_TO_STRING (
    p_table       IN     APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2,
    p_string      IN     VARCHAR2 DEFAULT ':') 
RETURN VARCHAR2;
TABLE_TO_STRING.descriptionText: Given a a PL/SQL table of type APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2, this function returns a delimited string separated by the supplied separator, or by the default separator, a colon (:).

UNEXPIRE_END_USER_ACCOUNT.name: apex_util.unexpire_end_user_account
UNEXPIRE_END_USER_ACCOUNT.descriptionText: Makes expired end users accounts and the associated passwords usable, enabling a end user to log in to developed applications.

UNEXPIRE_WORKSPACE_ACCOUNT.name: apex_util.unexpire_workspace_account
UNEXPIRE_WORKSPACE_ACCOUNT.descriptionText: Unexpires developer and workspace administrator accounts and the associated passwords, enabling the developer or administrator to log in to a workspace.

UNLOCK_ACCOUNT.name: apex_util.unlock_account
UNLOCK_ACCOUNT.descriptionText: Sets a user account status to unlocked. Must be run by an authenticated workspace administrator in a page request context.

URL_ENCODE.name: apex_util.url_encode
URL_ENCODE.descriptionText: The following special characters are encoded as follows:

WORKSPACE_ACCOUNT_DAYS_LEFT.name: apex_util.workspace_account_days_left
WORKSPACE_ACCOUNT_DAYS_LEFT.descriptionText: Returns the number of days remaining before the developer or workspace administrator account password expires. This function may be run in a page request context by any authenticated user.

BLOB2CLOBBASE64.name: apex_web_service.blob2clobbase64
BLOB2CLOBBASE64.descriptionText: Use this function to convert a BLOB datatype into a CLOB that is base64 encoded. This is often used when sending a binary as an input to a Web service.

CLOBBASE642BLOB.name: apex_web_service.clobbase642blob
CLOBBASE642BLOB.descriptionText: Use this function to convert a CLOB datatype that is base64 encoded into a BLOB. This is often used when receiving output from a Web service that contains a binary parameter.

MAKE_REQUEST.name: apex_web_service.make_request
MAKE_REQUEST.body:
p_url => $1
	, p_action => null
	, p_version => '1.1'
	, p_collection_name => null
	, p_envelope => $2
	, p_username => null
	, p_password => null
	, p_scheme => 'Basic'
	, p_proxy_override => null
	, p_transfer_timeout => 180
	, p_wallet_path => null
	, p_wallet_pwd => null
MAKE_REQUEST.bodyNoDefault:
p_url => $1
	, p_action => $2
	, p_version => $3
	, p_collection_name => $4
	, p_envelope => $5
	, p_username => $6
	, p_password => $7
	, p_scheme => $8
	, p_proxy_override => $9
	, p_transfer_timeout => $10
	, p_wallet_path => $11
	, p_wallet_pwd => $12
MAKE_REQUEST.bodyFullText:
APEX_WEB_SERVICE.MAKE_REQUEST (
    p_url               IN VARCHAR2,
    p_action            IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_version           IN VARCHAR2 default '1.1',
    p_collection_name   IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_envelope          IN CLOB,
    p_username          IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_password          IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_scheme            IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'Basic',
    p_proxy_override    IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_transfer_timeout  IN NUMBER   default 180,
    p_wallet_path       IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_wallet_pwd        IN VARCHAR2 default null );
MAKE_REQUEST.descriptionText: Use this procedure to invoke a SOAP style Web service with the supplied SOAP envelope and store the results in a collection.

MAKE_REST_REQUEST.name: apex_web_service.make_rest_request
MAKE_REST_REQUEST.body:
p_url => $1
	, p_http_method => $2
	, p_username => null
	, p_password => null
	, p_scheme => 'Basic'
	, p_proxy_override => null
	, p_transfer_timeout => 180
	, p_body => empty_clob()
	, p_body_blob => empty_blob()
	, p_parm_name => empty_vc_arr
	, p_parm_value => empty_vc_arr
	, p_wallet_path => null
	, p_wallet_pwd => null
MAKE_REST_REQUEST.bodyNoDefault:
p_url => $1
	, p_http_method => $2
	, p_username => $3
	, p_password => $4
	, p_scheme => $5

TRAIN.descriptionText: Use this procedure to generate query rules that select document categories. You must supply a training set consisting of categorized documents. Documents can be in any format supported by Oracle Text and must belong to one or more categories. This procedure generates the queries that define the categories and then writes the results to a table.

SNIPPET.body: index_name => $1 , textkey => $2 , text_query => $3 , starttag => '' , endtag => '' , entity_translation => TRUE , separator => '...' , radius => 25 , max_length => 250 , use_saved_copy => CTX_DOC.SAVE_COPY_FALLBACK , return => $4

SNIPPET.bodyFullText: CTX_DOC.SNIPPET( index_name IN VARCHAR2, textkey IN VARCHAR2, text_query IN VARCHAR2, starttag IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '', endtag IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '', entity_translation IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE, separator IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '...', radius IN INTEGER DEFAULT 25, max_length IN INTEGER DEFAULT 250 use_saved_copy IN NUMBER DEFAULT CTX_DOC.SAVE_COPY_FALLBACK return varchar2 );
SNIPPET.descriptionText: Use the CTX_DOC.SNIPPET procedure to produce a concordance for a document. The output of a snippet is a collection of segments. A concordance is a text fragment that contains a query term with some of its surrounding text. This is also sometimes known as Key Word in Context or KWIC, because it returns query keywords marked up in their surrounding text, which enables the user to evaluate them in context. The returned text can also contain themes that satisfy an ABOUT query.

ADD_EVENT.name: ctx_output.add_event
ADD_EVENT.bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.ADD_EVENT(event in NUMBER, errnum in NUMBER := null);
ADD_EVENT.descriptionText: Use this procedure to add an event to the index log for more detailed log output or to enable error tracing for Oracle Text errors.

ADD_TRACE.name: ctx_output.add_trace
ADD_TRACE.descriptionText: Use this procedure to enable a trace. If the trace has not been enabled, this call adds the trace to the list of active traces and resets its value to 0. If the trace has already been enabled, an error is raised.

DISABLE_QUERY_STATS.name: ctx_output.disable_query_stats
DISABLE_QUERY_STATS.descriptionText: Disables gathering of query stats for the index.

ENABLE_QUERY_STATS.name: ctx_output.enable_query_stats
ENABLE_QUERY_STATS.descriptionText: Enables gathering of query stats for the index. To have query-related metadata stored for the index, use this procedure to enable collection of statistics on that index. You can only access the gathered metadata when ctx_output.enable_query_stats is turned on for the index.

END_LOG.name: ctx_output.end_log
END_LOG.descriptionText: This procedure halts logging index and document service requests.

END_QUERY_LOG.name: ctx_output.end_query_log
END_QUERY_LOG.descriptionText: Use this procedure to stop logging queries into a logfile created with CTX_OUTPUT.START_QUERY_LOG.

GET_TRACE_VALUE.name: ctx_output.get_trace_value
GET_TRACE_VALUE.descriptionText: Use this procedure to programmatically retrieve the current value of a trace.

LOG_TRACES.name: ctx_output.log_traces
LOG_TRACES.descriptionText: Use this procedure to print all active traces to the logfile.

LOGFILENAME.name: ctx_output.logfilename
LOGFILENAME.descriptionText: Returns the filename for the current log. This procedure looks for the logfile in the directory specified by the LOG_DIRECTORY system parameter, which is $ORACLE_HOME/ctx/log on UNIX. You can query the CTX_PARAMETERS view to find the current setting.

REMOVE_EVENT.name: ctx_output.remove_event
REMOVE_EVENT.descriptionText: Use this procedure to remove an event from the index log.

REMOVE_TRACE.name: ctx_output.remove_trace
REMOVE_TRACE.descriptionText: Use this procedure to disable a trace.

RESET_TRACE.name: ctx_output.reset_trace
RESET_TRACE.descriptionText: Use this procedure to clear a trace (that is, reset it to 0).

START_LOG.name: ctx_output.start_log
START_LOG.bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.START_LOG(logfile in varchar2, overwrite in default true);
START_LOG.descriptionText: Begin logging index and document service requests.

START_QUERY_LOG.name: ctx_output.start_query_log
START_QUERY_LOG.bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.START_QUERY_LOG(logfile in varchar2, overwrite in default true);
START_QUERY_LOG.descriptionText: Begin logging query requests into a query log file.

BROWSE_WORDS.descriptionText: This procedure enables you to browse words in an Oracle Text index. Specify a seed word and BROWSE_WORDS returns the words around it in the index, and an approximate count of the number of documents that contain each word.

COUNT_HITS.name: ctx_query.count_hits
COUNT_HITS.body:
index_name => $1
	, text_query => $2
	, exact => TRUE
	, part_name => NULL
COUNT_HITS.descriptionText: Returns the number of hits for the specified query. You can call COUNT_HITS in exact or estimate mode. Exact mode returns the exact number of hits for the query. Estimate mode returns an upper-bound estimate but runs faster than exact mode.

CREATE_INDEX_SCRIPT.name: ctx_report.create_index_script

CREATE_POLICY_SCRIPT.name: ctx_report.create_policy_script

DESCRIBE_INDEX.name: ctx_report.describe_index
DESCRIBE_INDEX.descriptionText: Creates a report describing the index. This includes the settings of the index metadata, the indexing objects used, the settings of the attributes of the objects, and index partition descriptions, if any.

DESCRIBE_POLICY.name: ctx_report.describe_policy
DESCRIBE_POLICY.descriptionText: Creates a report describing the policy. This includes the settings of the policy metadata, the indexing objects used, and the settings of the attributes of the objects.
