DBMS_XDBZ.IS_HIERARCHY_ENABLED(
   object_schema   IN  VARCHAR2,
   object_name     IN  VARCHAR2,
   hierarchy_type  IN  PLS_INTEGER := IS_ENABLED_CONTENTS)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
IS_HIERARCHY_ENABLED.descriptionText: This function determines if repository support for the specified XMLType table or view is enabled.

PURGELDAPCACHE.name: dbms_xdbz.purgeldapcache
PURGELDAPCACHE.descriptionText: This function purges the LDAP nickname cache. Returns TRUE if successful.

SETOWNER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XDBZ.SETOWNER(
                RES IN/OUT PL/SQL RECORD 
        OWNER IN VARCHAR2 
)

CLEAR.name: dbms_xevent.clear
CLEAR.descriptionText: this procedure clears the handler list.

GETAPPLICATIONDATA.name: dbms_xevent.getapplicationdata
GETAPPLICATIONDATA.descriptionText: This function returns the <applicationData> element extracted from the resource configuration that defines the invoking handler.

GETCHILDOID.name: dbms_xevent.getchildoid
GETCHILDOID.descriptionText: This function returns the OID of the resource to which the link is pointing.

GETCURRENTUSER.name: dbms_xevent.getcurrentuser
GETCURRENTUSER.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the user executing the operation that triggers the event.

GETEVENT.name: dbms_xevent.getevent
GETEVENT.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the user executing the operation that triggers the event.

GETFIRST.name: dbms_xevent.getfirst
GETFIRST.descriptionText: This function returns the first handler in the list.

GETHANDLERLIST.name: dbms_xevent.gethandlerlist
GETHANDLERLIST.descriptionText: This function returns an XDBHandlerList object containing the list of handlers that will be executed after the currently executing handler. The current handler can then filter out some of the subsequent handlers if necessary, subject to security checks. An insufficient privilege exception is raised if the executing user does not have the required access privilege to any of the resource configuration associating with a handler in the list.

GETINTERFACE.name: dbms_xevent.getinterface
GETINTERFACE.descriptionText: This function returns the top-level interface used to initiate the operation that triggered the event. This could be HTTP, FTP or SQL.

GETLANGUAGE.name: dbms_xevent.getlanguage
GETLANGUAGE.descriptionText: This function returns the implementation language of the handler.

GETLINK.name: dbms_xevent.getlink
GETLINK.descriptionText: This function returns an XDBLink object for the target resource. For a link* or unlink* event, this will be the link involved in the operation. For other events, an error is returned. Using this object the handler can access link properties, such as, ParentName, ParentOID, ChildOID and LinkName.

GETLINKNAME.name: dbms_xevent.getlinkname
GETLINKNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the link.

GETLOCK.name: dbms_xevent.getlock
GETLOCK.descriptionText: This function returns the lock object corresponding to the current operation.I t is only valid for lock and unlock events.

GETNAME.name: dbms_xevent.getname
GETNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the string representation of the path.

GETNEXT.name: dbms_xevent.getnext
GETNEXT.descriptionText: This function returns the next handler in the list.

GETOLDRESOURCE.name: dbms_xevent.getoldresource
GETOLDRESOURCE.descriptionText: This function returns the original XDBResource object before the operation was executed. This method applies only to update event. For other events, an error is returned. This is a read-only object, and consequently none of the modifier methods will work on this object.

GETOPENACCESSMODE.name: dbms_xevent.getopenaccessmode
GETOPENACCESSMODE.descriptionText: This function returns the access mode for the open operation.

GETOPENDENYMODE.name: dbms_xevent.getopendenymode
GETOPENDENYMODE.descriptionText: This function returns the deny mode for the open operation. It is only valid for the open event.

GETOUTPUTSTREAM.name: dbms_xevent.getoutputstream
GETOUTPUTSTREAM.descriptionText: This function returns the output BLOB in which the handler can write the rendered data. It is only valid for the render event.

GETPARAMETER.name: dbms_xevent.getparameter
GETPARAMETER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETPARAMETER (
    ev   IN   XDBRepositoryEvent,
    key  IN   VARCHAR2) 
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
GETPARAMETER.descriptionText: This function returns the value of a request or session-specific parameter. The definition of the key parameter can be found in RFC 2616 (HTTP/1.1). They will be mapped to equivalent SQL session parameters (if any).

GETPARENT.name: dbms_xevent.getparent
GETPARENT.descriptionText: This function returns the resource object corresponding to a parent folder of the target resource. Note that this could be any folder that contains a link to the target resource. This is a read-only object, and consequently none of the modifier methods will work on this object. For a link* or unlink* event, this method returns the lin\'s parent folder.

GETPARENTNAME.name: dbms_xevent.getparentname
GETPARENTNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the lin\'s parent folde\'s name.

GETPARENTOID.name: dbms_xevent.getparentoid
GETPARENTOID.descriptionText: This function returns the lin\'s parent folde\'s OID.

GETPARENTPATH.name: dbms_xevent.getparentpath
GETPARENTPATH.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETPARENTPATH (
    path   IN   XDBPath,
   level   IN   INTEGER) 
  RETURN XDBPath;
GETPARENTPATH.descriptionText: This function returns the paren\'s path. The level indicates the number of levels up the hierarchy. This value must be greater than zero. Level 1 means the immediate parent. If level exceeds the height of the tree then a NULL is returned.

GETPATH.name: dbms_xevent.getpath
GETPATH.descriptionText: This function returns the XDBPath object representing the path of the resource for which the event was fired. From this object, functions are provided to get the different path segments.

GETRESOURCE.name: dbms_xevent.getresource
GETRESOURCE.descriptionText: This function returns an XDBResource object that provides methods to access and modify the contents and metadata of the target resource. This object reflects any changes made by previous handlers to the resource.

GETSCHEMA.name: dbms_xevent.getschema
GETSCHEMA.descriptionText: This function returns the schema of the handle\'s source.

GETSOURCE.name: dbms_xevent.getsource
GETSOURCE.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the Java class, PL/SQL package or object type implementing the handler.

GETUPDATEBYTECOUNT.name: dbms_xevent.getupdatebytecount
GETUPDATEBYTECOUNT.descriptionText: If the current operation is a byte-range write, the function returns the byte count. It is only valid for the inconsistent-update event.

GETUPDATEBYTEOFFSET.name: dbms_xevent.getupdatebyteoffset
GETUPDATEBYTEOFFSET.descriptionText: If the current operation is a byte-range write, function returns the byte offset at which the range begins. It is only valid for the inconsistent-update event.

GETXDBETEVENT.name: dbms_xevent.getxdbetevent
GETXDBETEVENT.descriptionText: This function converts an XDBRepositoryEvent object to an XDBEvent type.

ISNULL.name: dbms_xevent.isnull
ISNULL.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if input argument is NULL.

REMOVE.name: dbms_xevent.remove
REMOVE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the specified handler from the handler list.

SETRENDERPATH.name: dbms_xevent.setrenderpath
SETRENDERPATH.descriptionText: This procedure specifies the path of the resource that contains the rendered contents. This should not be called after the stream returned by GETOUTPUTSTREAM Function is written to or after the SETRENDERSTREAM Procedure is called; doing so will result in an error. This is only valid for the render event.

SETRENDERSTREAM.name: dbms_xevent.setrenderstream
SETRENDERSTREAM.descriptionText: This procedure sets the BLOB from which the rendered contents can be read. This should not be called after the stream returned by GETOUTPUTSTREAM is written to or after SETRENDERPATH is called; doing so will result in an error. This is only valid for the render event.

ISCHECKEDOUT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.ISCHECKEDOUT(
                PATHNAME IN VARCHAR2 
)
return PL/SQL

)
return VARCHAR2

GETDAVTOKEN.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETDAVTOKEN(
        LK IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return VARCHAR2

GETDEPTH.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETDEPTH(
        LK IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return BINARY_INTEGER

GETEXPIRY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETEXPIRY(
        LK IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return TIMESTAMP

GETLOCKMODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETLOCKMODE(
        LK IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return BINARY_INTEGER

GETLOCKTYPE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETLOCKTYPE(
        LK IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return BINARY_INTEGER

GETNFSNODEID.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETNFSNODEID(
        LK IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return RAW

ADOPTNODE.name: dbms_xmldom.adoptnode
ADOPTNODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.ADOPTNODE(
   doc            IN   DOMDocument,
   importedNode   IN   DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
ADOPTNODE.descriptionText: This function adopts a node from another document, and returns this new node.

APPENDCHILD.name: dbms_xmldom.appendchild
APPENDCHILD.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.APPENDCHILD(
   n          IN    DOMNode,
   newchild   IN    DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
APPENDCHILD.descriptionText: This function adds the node newchild to the end of the list of children of this node, and returns the newly added node. If the newchild is already in the tree, it is first removed.

APPENDDATA.name: dbms_xmldom.appenddata
APPENDDATA.descriptionText: This procedure appends the string to the end of the character data of the node. Upon success, data provides access to the concatenation of data and the specified string argument.

CLONENODE.name: dbms_xmldom.clonenode
CLONENODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CLONENODE(
   n       IN    DOMNODE,
   deep    IN    BOOLEAN)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
CLONENODE.descriptionText: This function returns a duplicate of this node, and serves as a generic copy constructor for nodes. The duplicate node has no parent, its parent node is NULL.

CREATEATTRIBUTE.name: dbms_xmldom.createattribute
CREATEATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEATTRIBUTE(
   doc     IN    DOMDOCUMENT,
   name    IN    VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMATTR;
CREATEATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: This function creates a DOMATTR node.

CREATECDATASECTION.name: dbms_xmldom.createcdatasection
CREATECDATASECTION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATECDATASECTION(
   doc     IN      DOMDOCUMENT,
   data    IN      VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMCDATASECTION;
CREATECDATASECTION.descriptionText: This function creates a DOMCDATASECTION node.

CREATECOMMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.createcomment
CREATECOMMENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATECOMMENT(
   doc      IN      DOMDOCUMENT,
   data     IN      VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMCOMMENT;
CREATECOMMENT.descriptionText: This function creates a DOMCOMMENT node.

CREATEDOCUMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.createdocument
CREATEDOCUMENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEDOCUMENT(
   namespaceURI      IN     VARCHAR2,
   qualifiedName     IN     VARCHAR2,
   doctype           IN     DOMTYPE := NULL)
 RETURN DOMDOCUMENT;
CREATEDOCUMENT.descriptionText: This function creates a DOMDOCUMENT with specified namespace URI, root element name, DTD.

CREATEDOCUMENTFRAGMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.createdocumentfragment

CREATEELEMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.createelement
CREATEELEMENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEELEMENT(
   doc        IN      DOMDOCUMENT,
   tagName    IN      VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMELEMENT;

CREATEENTITYREFERENCE.name: dbms_xmldom.createentityreference
CREATEENTITYREFERENCE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEENTITYREFERENCE(
   doc        IN     DOMDOCUMENT,
   name       IN     VARCHAR2)

CREATEENTITYREFERENCE.descriptionText: This function creates a DOMENTITYREFERENCE node.

CREATEPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION.name: dbms_xmldom.createprocessinginstruction
CREATEPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION(
   doc       IN      DOMDocument,

CREATETEXTNODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATETEXTNODE(
   doc      IN     DOMDocument,
   data     IN     VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMTEXT;
CREATETEXTNODE.descriptionText: This function creates a DOMTEXT node.

DELETEDATA.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.DELETEDATA(
   cd        IN     DOMCHARACTERDATA,
   offset    IN     NUMBER,
   cnt       IN     NUMBER);
DELETEDATA.descriptionText: This procedure removes a range of characters from the node. Upon success, data and length reflect the change.

FINDENTITY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.FINDENTITY(
   dt     IN     DOMDOCUMENTTYPE,
   name   IN     VARCHAR2,
   par    IN     BOOLEAN) 
 RETURN  DOMENTITY;
FINDENTITY.descriptionText: This function finds an entity in the specified DTD, and returns that entity if found.

FINDNOTATION.name: dbms_xmldom.findnotation
FINDNOTATION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.FINDNOTATION(
   dt        IN     DOMDocumentType,
   name      IN     VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN DOMNOTATION;
FINDNOTATION.descriptionText: This function finds the notation in the specified DTD, and returns it, if found.

FREEDOCFRAG.name: dbms_xmldom.freedocfrag
FREEDOCFRAG.descriptionText: This procedure frees the specified document fragment.

FREENODE.name: dbms_xmldom.freenode
FREENODE.descriptionText: This procedure frees memory allocated to a DOMElement handle.

GETATTRIBUTE.name: dbms_xmldom.getattribute
GETATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETATTRIBUTE(
   elem       IN      DOMELEMENT,
   name       IN      VARCHAR2)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
GETATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: This function returns the value of an attribute of an DOMELEMENT by name.

GETATTRIBUTENODE.name: dbms_xmldom.getattributenode
GETATTRIBUTENODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETATTRIBUTENODE(
   elem      IN     DOMElement,
   name      IN     VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMATTR;
GETATTRIBUTENODE.descriptionText: This function returns an attribute node from the DOMELEMENT by name. The function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETATTRIBUTES.name: dbms_xmldom.getattributes
GETATTRIBUTES.descriptionText: This function retrieves a NAMEDNODEMAP containing the attributes of this node (if it is an Element) or NULL otherwise.

GETCHARSET.name: dbms_xmldom.getcharset
GETCHARSET.descriptionText: This function retrieves the characterset of the DOM document.

GETCHILDNODES.name: dbms_xmldom.getchildnodes
GETCHILDNODES.descriptionText: This function retrieves a DOMNODELIST that contains all children of this node. If there are no children, this is a DOMNODELIST containing no nodes.

GETCHILDRENBYTAGNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getchildrenbytagname
GETCHILDRENBYTAGNAME.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETCHILDRENBYTAGNAME(
   elem      IN      DOMElement, 
   name      IN      VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN DOMNODELIST;
GETCHILDRENBYTAGNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the children of the DOMELEMENT.

GETDATA.name: dbms_xmldom.getdata
GETDATA.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETDOCTYPE.name: dbms_xmldom.getdoctype
GETDOCTYPE.descriptionText: This function returns the DTD associated to the DOMDOCUMENT.

GETDOCUMENTELEMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.getdocumentelement
GETDOCUMENTELEMENT.descriptionText: This function returns the root element of the DOMDOCUMENT.

GETELEMENTSBYTAGNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getelementsbytagname
GETELEMENTSBYTAGNAME.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETELEMENTSBYTAGNAME(
   doc         IN      DOMDOCUMENT,
   tagname     IN      VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMNODELIST;
GETELEMENTSBYTAGNAME.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETENTITIES.name: dbms_xmldom.getentities
GETENTITIES.descriptionText: This function retrieves a DOMNAMEDNODEMAP containing the general entities, both external and internal, declared in the DTD.

GETEXPANDEDNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getexpandedname
GETEXPANDEDNAME.descriptionText: This subprogram is overloaded as a procedure and two functions. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETFIRSTCHILD.name: dbms_xmldom.getfirstchild
GETFIRSTCHILD.descriptionText: This function retrieves the first child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

GETIMPLEMENTATION.name: dbms_xmldom.getimplementation
GETIMPLEMENTATION.descriptionText: This function returns the DOMIMPLEMENTATION object that handles this DOMDOCUMENT.

GETLASTCHILD.name: dbms_xmldom.getlastchild
GETLASTCHILD.descriptionText: This function retrieves the last child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

GETLENGTH.name: dbms_xmldom.getlength
GETLENGTH.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETLOCALNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getlocalname
GETLOCALNAME.descriptionText: This function is overloaded as a procedure and two functions. The specific forms of functionality are described alongside the syntax declarations.

GETNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getname
GETNAME.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described alongside the syntax declarations.

GETNAMEDITEM.name: dbms_xmldom.getnameditem
GETNAMEDITEM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETNAMEDITEM(
   nnm    IN  DOMNAMEDNODEMAP,
   name   IN  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
GETNAMEDITEM.descriptionText: This function retrieves a node specified by name.

GETNAMESPACE.name: dbms_xmldom.getnamespace
GETNAMESPACE.descriptionText: This subprogram is overloaded as a procedure and two functions. The specific forms of functionality are described alongside the syntax declarations.

GETNEXTSIBLING.name: dbms_xmldom.getnextsibling
GETNEXTSIBLING.descriptionText: This function retrieves the node immediately following this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

GETNODENAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getnodename
GETNODENAME.descriptionText: This function gets the name of the node depending on its type.

GETNODETYPE.name: dbms_xmldom.getnodetype
GETNODETYPE.descriptionText: This function retrieves a code representing the type of the underlying object.

GETNODEVALUE.name: dbms_xmldom.getnodevalue
GETNODEVALUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETNODEVALUE(
   n       IN     DOMNODE)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;*
GETNODEVALUE.descriptionText: This function gets the value of this node, depending on its type.

GETNODEVALUEASBINARYSTREAM.name: dbms_xmldom.getnodevalueasbinarystream
GETNODEVALUEASBINARYSTREAM.descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

GETNODEVALUEASCHARACTERSTREAM.name: dbms_xmldom.getnodevalueascharacterstream
GETNODEVALUEASCHARACTERSTREAM.descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

GETNOTATIONNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getnotationname
GETNOTATIONNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the notation name of the DOMENTITY.

GETNOTATIONS.name: dbms_xmldom.getnotations
GETNOTATIONS.descriptionText: This function retrieves a DOMNAMEDNODEMAP containing the notations declared in the DTD.

GETOWNERDOCUMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.getownerdocument
GETOWNERDOCUMENT.descriptionText: This function retrieves the Document object associated with this node. This is also the Document object used to create new nodes. When this node is a Document or a Document Type that is not used with any Document yet, this is NULL.

GETOWNERELEMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.getownerelement
GETOWNERELEMENT.descriptionText: This function retrieves the Element node to which the specified Attribute is attached.

GETPARENTNODE.name: dbms_xmldom.getparentnode
GETPARENTNODE.descriptionText: This function retrieves the parent of this node. All nodes, except Attr, Document, DocumentFragment, Entity, and Notation may have a parent. However, if a node has just been created and not yet added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree, this is NULL.

GETPREFIX.name: dbms_xmldom.getprefix
GETPREFIX.descriptionText: This function retrieves the namespace prefix of the node.

GETPREVIOUSSIBLING.name: dbms_xmldom.getprevioussibling
GETPREVIOUSSIBLING.descriptionText: This function retrieves the node immediately preceding this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

GETPUBLICID.name: dbms_xmldom.getpublicid
GETPUBLICID.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETQUALIFIEDNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.getqualifiedname
GETQUALIFIEDNAME.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETSCHEMANODE.name: dbms_xmldom.getschemanode
GETSCHEMANODE.descriptionText: This function retrieves the schema URI associated with the node.

GETSPECIFIED.name: dbms_xmldom.getspecified
GETSPECIFIED.descriptionText: If this attribute was explicitly specified, a value in the original document, this is true; otherwise, it is false.

GETSTANDALONE.name: dbms_xmldom.getstandalone
GETSTANDALONE.descriptionText: This function returns the standalone property associated with the DOMDOCUMENT.

GETSYSTEMID.name: dbms_xmldom.getsystemid
GETSYSTEMID.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

GETTAGNAME.name: dbms_xmldom.gettagname
GETTAGNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the DOMELEMENT.

GETTARGET.name: dbms_xmldom.gettarget
GETTARGET.descriptionText: This function returns the target of the DOMPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION.

GETVALUE.name: dbms_xmldom.getvalue
GETVALUE.descriptionText: This function retrieves the value of the attribute.

GETVERSION.name: dbms_xmldom.getversion
GETVERSION.descriptionText: This function returns the version of the DOMDOCUMENT.

GETXMLTYPE.name: dbms_xmldom.getxmltype
GETXMLTYPE.descriptionText: This function returns the XMLType associated with the DOMDOCUMENT.

HASATTRIBUTE.name: dbms_xmldom.hasattribute
HASATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.HASATTRIBUTE(
   elem     IN  DOMELEMENT,
   name     IN  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
HASATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: Verifies whether an attribute has been defined for DOMELEMENT, or has a default value.

HASATTRIBUTES.name: dbms_xmldom.hasattributes
HASATTRIBUTES.descriptionText: This function returns whether this node has any attributes.

HASCHILDNODES.name: dbms_xmldom.haschildnodes
HASCHILDNODES.descriptionText: This function determines whether this node has any children.

HASFEATURE.name: dbms_xmldom.hasfeature
HASFEATURE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.HASFEATURE(
   di       IN     DOMIMPLEMENTATION,
   feature  IN     VARCHAR2,
   version  IN     VARCHAR2)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
HASFEATURE.descriptionText: This function tests if the DOMIMPLEMENTATION implements a specific feature.

IMPORTNODE.name: dbms_xmldom.importnode
IMPORTNODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.IMPORTNODE(
   doc            IN  DOMDOCUMENT,
   importedNode   IN  DOMNODE,
   deep           IN  BOOLEAN)
  RETURN DOMNODE;
IMPORTNODE.descriptionText: This function imports a node from an external document and returns this new node.

INSERTBEFORE.name: dbms_xmldom.insertbefore
INSERTBEFORE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.INSERTBEFORE(
   n          IN     DOMNODE,
   newchild   IN     DOMNODE,
   refchild   IN     DOMNODE)
  RETURN DOMNode;
INSERTBEFORE.descriptionText: This function inserts the node newchild before the existing child node refchild. If refchild is NULL, insert newchild at the end of the list of children.

INSERTDATA.name: dbms_xmldom.insertdata
INSERTDATA.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.INSERTDATA(
   cd       IN     DOMCHARACTERDATA,
   offset   IN     NUMBER,
   arg      IN     VARCHAR2);
INSERTDATA.descriptionText: This procedure inserts a string at the specified character offset.

ISNULL.name: dbms_xmldom.isnull
ISNULL.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

ITEM.name: dbms_xmldom.item
ITEM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.ITEM(
   nnm       IN     DOMNAMEDNODEMAP,
   index     IN     NUMBER)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
ITEM.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

MAKEATTR.name: dbms_xmldom.makeattr
MAKEATTR.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMATTR, and returns the DOMATTR.

MAKECDATASECTION.name: dbms_xmldom.makecdatasection
MAKECDATASECTION.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMCDATASECTION.

MAKECHARACTERDATA.name: dbms_xmldom.makecharacterdata
MAKECHARACTERDATA.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMCHARACTERDATA, and returns the DOMCHARACTERDATA.

MAKECOMMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.makecomment
MAKECOMMENT.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMCOMMENT, and returns the DOMCOMMENT.

MAKEDOCUMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.makedocument
MAKEDOCUMENT.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMDOCUMENT, and returns the DOMDOCUMENT.

MAKEDOCUMENTFRAGMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.makedocumentfragment
MAKEDOCUMENTFRAGMENT.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMDOCUMENTFRAGMENT, and returns the DOMDOCUMENTFRAGMENT.

MAKEDOCUMENTTYPE.name: dbms_xmldom.makedocumenttype
MAKEDOCUMENTTYPE.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMDOCUMENTTYPE and returns the DOMDOCUMENTTYPE.

MAKEELEMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.makeelement
MAKEELEMENT.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMELEMENT, and returns the DOMELEMENT.

MAKEENTITY.name: dbms_xmldom.makeentity
MAKEENTITY.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMENTITY, and returns the DOMENTITY.

MAKEENTITYREFERENCE.name: dbms_xmldom.makeentityreference
MAKEENTITYREFERENCE.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMENTITYREFERENCE, and returns the DOMENTITYREFERENCE.

MAKENODE.name: dbms_xmldom.makenode
MAKENODE.descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

MAKENOTATION.name: dbms_xmldom.makenotation
MAKENOTATION.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMNOTATION, and returns the DOMNOTATION.

MAKEPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION.name: dbms_xmldom.makeprocessinginstruction
MAKEPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION, and returns the Domprocessinginstruction.

MAKETEXT.name: dbms_xmldom.maketext
MAKETEXT.descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMTEXT, and returns the DOMTEXT.

NEWDOMDOCUMENT.name: dbms_xmldom.newdomdocument
NEWDOMDOCUMENT.descriptionText: This function returns a new DOMDOCUMENT instance.

NORMALIZE.name: dbms_xmldom.normalize
NORMALIZE.descriptionText: This procedure normalizes the text children of the DOMELEMENT.

REMOVEATTRIBUTE.name: dbms_xmldom.removeattribute
REMOVEATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: This procedure removes an attribute from the DOMELEMENT by name.

REMOVEATTRIBUTENODE.name: dbms_xmldom.removeattributenode
REMOVEATTRIBUTENODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REMOVEATTRIBUTENODE(
   elem       IN     DOMELEMENT,
   oldAttr    IN     DOMATTR)
  RETURN DOMAttr;
REMOVEATTRIBUTENODE.descriptionText: This function removes the specified attribute node from the DOMELEMENT. The method returns the removed node.

REMOVECHILD.name: dbms_xmldom.removechild
REMOVECHILD.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REMOVECHILD(
   n          IN     DOMNode,
   oldchild   IN     DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
REMOVECHILD.descriptionText: This function removes the child node indicated by oldchild from the list of children, and returns it.

REMOVENAMEDITEM.name: dbms_xmldom.removenameditem
REMOVENAMEDITEM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REMOVENAMEDITEM(
   nnm      IN     DOMNamedNodeMap,
   name     IN     VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMNode;
REMOVENAMEDITEM.descriptionText: This function removes from the map a node specified by name, and returns this node. When this map contains the attributes attached to an element, if the removed attribute is known to have a default value, an attribute immediately appears containing the default value as well as the corresponding namespace URI, local name, and prefix when applicable.

REPLACECHILD.name: dbms_xmldom.replacechild
REPLACECHILD.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REPLACECHILD(
   n           IN     DOMNode,
   newchild    IN     DOMNode,
   oldchild    IN     DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNode;
REPLACECHILD.descriptionText: This function replaces the child node oldchild with newchild in the list of children, and returns the oldchild node. If newchild is a DocumentFragment object, oldchild is replaced by all of the DocumentFragment children, which are inserted in the same order. If the newchild is already in the tree, it is first removed.

REPLACEDATA.name: dbms_xmldom.replacedata
REPLACEDATA.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REPLACEDATA(
   cd        IN     DOMCHARACTERDATA,
   offset    IN     NUMBER,
   cnt       IN     NUMBER,
   arg       IN     VARCHAR2);
REPLACEDATA.descriptionText: This procedure changes a range of characters in the node. Upon success, data and length reflect the change.

RESOLVENAMESPACEPREFIX.name: dbms_xmldom.resolvenamespaceprefix
RESOLVENAMESPACEPREFIX.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.RESOLVENAMESPACEPREFIX(
   elem       IN     DOMELEMENT,
   prefix     IN     VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
RESOLVENAMESPACEPREFIX.descriptionText: This function resolves the specified namespace prefix, and returns the resolved namespace.

SETATTRIBUTE.name: dbms_xmldom.setattribute
SETATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETATTRIBUTE(
   elem       IN  DOMELEMENT,
   name       IN  VARCHAR2,
   newvalue   IN  VARCHAR2);
SETATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: Sets the value of a DOMELEMEN\'s attribute by name.

SETATTRIBUTENODE.name: dbms_xmldom.setattributenode
SETATTRIBUTENODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETATTRIBUTENODE(
   elem      IN  DOMELEMENT,
   newAttr   IN  DOMATTR)
 RETURN DOMATTR;
SETATTRIBUTENODE.descriptionText: Adds a new attribute node to the DOMELEMENT.

SETCHARSET.name: dbms_xmldom.setcharset
SETCHARSET.descriptionText: This function sets the characterset of the DOM document.

SETDATA.name: dbms_xmldom.setdata
SETDATA.descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

SETDOCTYPE.name: dbms_xmldom.setdoctype
SETDOCTYPE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETDOCTYPE(
  doc     IN   DOMDocument, 
  name    IN   VARCHAR2,
  sysid   IN   VARCHAR2, 
  pubid   IN   VARCHAR2);
SETDOCTYPE.descriptionText: Given a DOM document, this procedure creates a new DTD with the specified name, system id and public id and sets it in the document. This DTD can later be retrieved using the GETDOCTYPE Function.

SETNAMEDITEM.name: dbms_xmldom.setnameditem
SETNAMEDITEM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETNAMEDITEM(
   nnm     IN     DOMNAMEDNODEMAP,
   arg     IN     DOMNODE)
 RETURN DOMNode;
SETNAMEDITEM.descriptionText: This function adds a node using its NodeName attribute. If a node with that name is already present in this map, it is replaced by the new one. The old node is returned on replacement; if no replacement is made, NULL is returned.

SETNODEVALUE.name: dbms_xmldom.setnodevalue
SETNODEVALUE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the value of this node, depending on its type. When it is defined to be NULL, setting it has no effect.

SETNODEVALUEASBINARYSTREAM.name: dbms_xmldom.setnodevalueasbinarystream
SETNODEVALUEASBINARYSTREAM.descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

SETNODEVALUEASCHARACTERSTREAM.name: dbms_xmldom.setnodevalueascharacterstream
SETNODEVALUEASCHARACTERSTREAM.descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

SETPREFIX.name: dbms_xmldom.setprefix
SETPREFIX.descriptionText: This procedure sets the namespace prefix for this node to the specified value.

SETSTANDALONE.name: dbms_xmldom.setstandalone
SETSTANDALONE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the standalone property of the DOMDOCUMENT.

SETVALUE.name: dbms_xmldom.setvalue
SETVALUE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the value of the attribute.

SETVERSION.name: dbms_xmldom.setversion
SETVERSION.descriptionText: This procedure sets the version of the DOMDOCUMENT.

SPLITTEXT.name: dbms_xmldom.splittext
SPLITTEXT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SPLITTEXT(
   t        IN     DOMTEXT,
   offset   IN     NUMBER)
 RETURN DOMText;
SPLITTEXT.descriptionText: This function breaks this DOMTEXT node into two DOMTEXT nodes at the specified offset.

SUBSTRINGDATA.name: dbms_xmldom.substringdata
SUBSTRINGDATA.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SUBSTRINGDATA(
   cd        IN     DOMCHARACTERDATA,
   offset    IN     NUMBER,
   cnt       IN     NUMBER)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
SUBSTRINGDATA.descriptionText: This function extracts a range of data from the node.

USEBINARYSTREAM.name: dbms_xmldom.usebinarystream
USEBINARYSTREAM.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the datatype of the node is RAW or BLOB so that the node value may be read or written using an UTL_BINARYINPUTSTREAM or UTL_BINARYOUTPUTSTREAM. If a value of FALSE is returned, the node value may only be accessed through an UTL_CHARACTERINPUTSTREAM or UTL_CHARACTEROUTPUTSTREAM.

WRITETOBUFFER.name: dbms_xmldom.writetobuffer
WRITETOBUFFER.descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

WRITETOFILE.name: dbms_xmldom.writetofile
WRITETOFILE.descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

DBMS_XMLDOM.WRITEEXTERNALDTDTOFILE(

CLOSECONTEXT.name: dbms_xmlgen.closecontext
CLOSECONTEXT.descriptionText: This procedure closes a given context and releases all resources associated with it, including the SQL cursor and bind and define buffers. After this call, the handle cannot be used for a subsequent function call.

CONVERT.name: dbms_xmlgen.convert
CONVERT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.CONVERT (
   xmlData IN VARCHAR2,
   flag    IN NUMBER := ENTITY_ENCODE)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
CONVERT.descriptionText: This function converts the XML data into the escaped or unescapes XML equivalent, and returns XML CLOB data in encoded or decoded format. There are several version of the function.

GETNUMROWSPROCESSED.name: dbms_xmlgen.getnumrowsprocessed
GETNUMROWSPROCESSED.descriptionText: This function retrieves the number of SQL rows processed when generating the XML using the GETXML Functions call. This count does not include the number of rows skipped before generating the XML. Note that GETXML Functions always generates an XML document, even if there are no rows present.

GETXML.name: dbms_xmlgen.getxml
GETXML.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.GETXML (
   ctx          IN ctxHandle, 
   tmpclob      IN OUT NCOPY CLOB,
   dtdOrSchema  IN number := NONE)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
GETXML.descriptionText: This function gets the XML document. The function is overloaded.

GETXMLTYPE.name: dbms_xmlgen.getxmltype
GETXMLTYPE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.GETXMLTYPE (
   ctx           IN ctxhandle,
   dtdOrSchema   IN number := NONE)
 RETURN sys.XMLType;
GETXMLTYPE.descriptionText: This function gets the XML document and returns it as an XMLTYPE. XMLTYPE operations can be performed on the results.This function is overloaded.

NEWCONTEXT.name: dbms_xmlgen.newcontext
NEWCONTEXT.descriptionText: This function generates and returns a new context handle. This context handle is used in GETXML Functions and other functions to get XML back from the result. There are several version of the function.

NEWCONTEXTFROMHIERARCHY.name: dbms_xmlgen.newcontextfromhierarchy
NEWCONTEXTFROMHIERARCHY.descriptionText: This function obtains a handle to use in the GETXML Functions and other functions to get a hierarchical XML with recursive elements from the result.

RESTARTQUERY.name: dbms_xmlgen.restartquery
RESTARTQUERY.descriptionText: This procedure restarts the query and generates the XML from the first row. It can be used to start executing the query again, without having to create a new context.

SETCONVERTSPECIALCHARS.name: dbms_xmlgen.setconvertspecialchars
SETCONVERTSPECIALCHARS.descriptionText: This procedure sets whether or not special characters in the XML data must be converted into their escaped XML equivalent. For example, the < sign is converted to <. The default is to perform conversions. This function improves performance of XML processing when the input data cannot contain any special characters such as <, >, "\', which must be escaped. It is expensive to scan the character data to replace the special characters, particularly if it involves a lot of data.

SETMAXROWS.name: dbms_xmlgen.setmaxrows
SETMAXROWS.descriptionText: This procedure sets the maximum number of rows to fetch from the SQL query result for every invocation of the GETXML Functions call. It is used when generating paginated results. For example, when generating a page of XML or HTML data, restrict the number of rows converted to XML or HTML by setting the maxrows parameter.

SETNULLHANDLING.name: dbms_xmlgen.setnullhandling
SETNULLHANDLING.descriptionText: This procedure sets NULL handling options, handled through the flag parameter setting.

SETROWSETTAG.name: dbms_xmlgen.setrowsettag
SETROWSETTAG.descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the root element of the document. The default name is ROWSET.

SETROWTAG.name: dbms_xmlgen.setrowtag
SETROWTAG.descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the element separating all the rows. The default name is ROW.

SETSKIPROWS.name: dbms_xmlgen.setskiprows
SETSKIPROWS.descriptionText: This procedure skips a given number of rows before generating the XML output for every call to the GETXML Functions. It is used when generating paginated results for stateless Web pages using this utility. For example, when generating the first page of XML or HTML data, set skiprows to zero. For the next set, set the skiprows to the number of rows obtained in the first case. See GETNUMROWSPROCESSED Function.

USEITEMTAGSFORCOLL.name: dbms_xmlgen.useitemtagsforcoll
USEITEMTAGSFORCOLL.descriptionText: This procedure overrides the default name of the collection elements. The default name for collection elements is the type name itself.

USENULLATTRIBUTEINDICATOR.name: dbms_xmlgen.usenullattributeindicator
USENULLATTRIBUTEINDICATOR.descriptionText: This procedure specifies whether to use an XML attribute to indicate NULLness, or to do it by omitting the inclusion of the particular entity in the XML document. It is used as a shortcut for the SETNULLHANDLING Procedure.

XMLD_USEBINSTREAM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.XMLD_USEBINSTREAM(
                N IN RAW 
)
return PL/SQL

REMOVEXSLTPARAM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.REMOVEXSLTPARAM(
        CTX IN NUMBER 
        NAME IN VARCHAR2 
)

SETBINDVALUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.SETBINDVALUE(
        CTX IN NUMBER 
        BINDNAME IN VARCHAR2 
        BINDVALUE IN VARCHAR2 
)

SETCHECKINVALIDCHARS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.SETCHECKINVALIDCHARS(
        CTX IN NUMBER 
        CHK IN PL/SQL BOOLEAN 
)

SETINDENTATIONWIDTH.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.SETINDENTATIONWIDTH(
        CTX IN NUMBER 
        WIDTH IN NUMBER 
)

SETPRETTYPRINTING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.SETPRETTYPRINTING(
        CTX IN NUMBER 
        PP IN PL/SQL BOOLEAN 
)

SETXSLT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.SETXSLT(
        CTX IN NUMBER 
        STYLESHEET IN CLOB 
)

CREATEDATEINDEX.name: dbms_xmlindex.createdateindex
CREATEDATEINDEX.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.CREATEDATEINDEX  (
   xml_index_schema   IN   VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   date_index_name    IN   VARCHAR2,
   xmltypename        IN   VARCHAR2,
   date_index_clause  IN   VARCHAR2);

DBMS_XMLINDEX.CREATEDATEINDEX  (
   xml_index_schema   IN   VARCHAR2
   xml_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   date_index_name    IN   VARCHAR2,
   xmltypename        IN   VARCHAR2);
CREATEDATEINDEX.descriptionText: This procedure creates a secondary index for date values in the VALUE column of a PATH TABLE which is the storage table of an XMLIndex. The second form of the procedure allows for the date_index_clause to be set to an empty string.

CREATENUMBERINDEX.name: dbms_xmlindex.createnumberindex
CREATENUMBERINDEX.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.CREATENUMBERINDEX (
   xml_index_schema   IN   VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   num_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   num_index_clause   IN   VARCHAR2,
   xmltypename        IN   VARCHAR2);
CREATENUMBERINDEX.descriptionText: This procedure creates a secondary index for number values in the VALUE column of a PATH TABLE which is the storage table of an XMLIndex.

DROPPARAMETER.name: dbms_xmlindex.dropparameter
DROPPARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure drops the XMLIndex parameter string that is associated with a given parameter identifier.

MODIFYPARAMETER.name: dbms_xmlindex.modifyparameter
MODIFYPARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure modifies the XMLIndex parameter string that is associated with a given parameter identifier.

PROCESS_PENDING.name: dbms_xmlindex.process_pending
PROCESS_PENDING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.PROCESS_PENDING (
   xml_index_schema    IN     VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name      IN     VARCHAR2,
   pending_row_count   OUT    BINARY_INTEGER,
   error_row_count     OUT    BINARY_INTEGER);
PROCESS_PENDING.descriptionText: This procedure processes executes DMLs required to complete a NONBLOCKING ALTER INDEX ADD_GROUP/ADD_COLUMN operation on an XMLIndex.

REGISTERPARAMETER.name: dbms_xmlindex.registerparameter
REGISTERPARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure registers a parameter identifier and XMLIndex parameter string pair in XDB.

SYNCINDEX.name: dbms_xmlindex.syncindex
SYNCINDEX.body:
xml_index_schema => $1
	, xml_index_name => $2
	, partition_name => NULL
	, reindex => FALSE
SYNCINDEX.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.SYNCINDEX (
   xml_index_schema      IN VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name        IN VARCHAR2,
   partition_name        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   reindex               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
SYNCINDEX.descriptionText: This function synchronizes an asynchronously maintained XMLIndex. It applies to the XMLIndex changes that are logged in the pending table, and brings the path table up-to-date with the base XMLTYPE column.

SETXSLTPARAM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.SETXSLTPARAM(
                CTX IN NUMBER 
        NAME IN VARCHAR2 
        VALUE IN VARCHAR2 
)

GETDOCTYPE.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getdoctype
GETDOCTYPE.descriptionText: Returns the parsed DTD; this function must be called only after a DTD is parsed.

GETDOCUMENT.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getdocument
GETDOCUMENT.descriptionText: Returns the document node of a DOM tree document built by the parser; this function must be called only after a document is parsed.

GETRELEASEVERSION.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getreleaseversion
GETRELEASEVERSION.descriptionText: Returns the release version of the Oracle XML parser for PL/SQL.

GETVALIDATIONMODE.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getvalidationmode
GETVALIDATIONMODE.descriptionText: Retrieves validation mode; TRUE for validating, FALSE otherwise.

NEWPARSER.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.newparser
NEWPARSER.descriptionText: Returns a new parser instance. This function must be called before the default behavior of Parser can be changed and if other parse methods need to be used.

PARSEBUFFER.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsebuffer
PARSEBUFFER.descriptionText: Parses XML stored in the given buffer. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

PARSECLOB.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parseclob
PARSECLOB.descriptionText: Parses XML stored in the given clob. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

PARSEDTD.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsedtd
PARSEDTD.bodyFullText:
PARSEDTD(
p     Parser,
url   VARCHAR2,
root  VARCHAR2);
PARSEDTD.descriptionText: Parses the DTD stored in the given URL or file. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

PARSEDTDBUFFER.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsedtdbuffer
PARSEDTDBUFFER.bodyFullText:
PARSEDTDBUFFER(
p    Parser,
dtd  VARCHAR2,
root VARCHAR2);
PARSEDTDBUFFER.descriptionText: Parses the DTD stored in the given buffer. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

PARSEDTDCLOB.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsedtdclob
PARSEDTDCLOB.bodyFullText:
PARSEDTDCLOB(
p    Parser,
dtd  CLOB,
root VARCHAR2);
PARSEDTDCLOB.descriptionText: Parses the DTD stored in the given clob. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

SETBASEDIR.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.setbasedir
SETBASEDIR.descriptionText: Sets base directory used to resolve relative URLs. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

SETDOCTYPE.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.setdoctype
SETDOCTYPE.descriptionText: Sets a DTD to be used by the parser for validation. This call should be made before the document is parsed.

SETERRORLOG.name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.seterrorlog
SETERRORLOG.descriptionText: Sets errors to be sent to the specified file.

GETPARAMETER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLPARSER.GETPARAMETER(
                PARAMNAME IN VARCHAR2 
)
return VARCHAR2

GETBASEDIR.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLPARSER.GETBASEDIR(
        P IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return VARCHAR2

GETERRORLOG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLPARSER.GETERRORLOG(
        P IN PL/SQL RECORD 
)
return VARCHAR2

RETAINCDATASECTION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLPARSER.RETAINCDATASECTION(
        P IN PL/SQL RECORD 
        FLAG IN PL/SQL BOOLEAN 
)

CLOSECONTEXT.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.closecontext
CLOSECONTEXT.descriptionText: Closes or deallocates a particular query context

GETEXCEPTIONCONTENT.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.getexceptioncontent
GETEXCEPTIONCONTENT.bodyFullText:
GETEXCEPTIONCONTENT(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
errNo OUT NUMBER,
errMsg OUT VARCHAR2);
GETEXCEPTIONCONTENT.descriptionText: Returns the thrown exceptio\'s SQL error code and error message through the procedur\'s OUT parameters. This procedure is a work around the JVM functionality that obscures the original exception by its own exception, rendering PL/SQL unable to access the original exception content.

GETNUMROWSPROCESSED.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.getnumrowsprocessed
GETNUMROWSPROCESSED.descriptionText: Return the number of rows processed for the query.

GETVERSION.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.getversion
GETVERSION.descriptionText: Prints the version of the XSU in use.

PROPAGATEORIGINALEXCEPTION.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.propagateoriginalexception
PROPAGATEORIGINALEXCEPTION.descriptionText: Specifies whether to throw every original exception raised or to wrap it in an OracleXMLSQLException.

REMOVEXSLTPARAM.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.removexsltparam
REMOVEXSLTPARAM.descriptionText: Removes the value of a top-level stylesheet parameter. If no stylesheet is registered, this method is not operational.

SETBINDVALUE.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setbindvalue
SETBINDVALUE.bodyFullText:
SETBINDVALUE(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
bindName IN VARCHAR2,
bindValue IN VARCHAR2);
SETBINDVALUE.descriptionText: Sets a value for a particular bind name.

SETCOLLIDATTRNAME.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setcollidattrname
SETCOLLIDATTRNAME.descriptionText: Sets the name of the id attribute of the collection elemen\'s separator tag. Passing NULL or an empty string for the tag causes the row id attribute to be omitted.

SETDATAHEADER.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setdataheader
SETDATAHEADER.bodyFullText:
SETDATAHEADER(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
header IN CLOB := null,
tag IN VARCHAR2 := null);
SETDATAHEADER.descriptionText: Sets the XML data header. The data header is an XML entity that is appended at the beginning of the query-generated XML entity, the rowset. The two entities are enclosed by the docTag argument. The last data header specified is used. Passing in NULL for the header parameter unsets the data header.

SETDATEFORMAT.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setdateformat
SETDATEFORMAT.descriptionText: Sets the format of the generated dates in the XML document. The syntax of the date format pattern, the date mask, should conform to the requirements of the java.text.SimpleDateFormat class. Setting the mask to NULL or an empty string sets the default mask -- DEFAULT_DATE_FORMAT.

SETENCODINGTAG.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setencodingtag
SETENCODINGTAG.descriptionText: Sets the encoding processing instruction in the XML document.

SETERRORTAG.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.seterrortag
SETERRORTAG.descriptionText: Sets the tag to be used to enclose the XML error documents.

SETMAXROWS.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setmaxrows
SETMAXROWS.descriptionText: Sets the maximum number of rows to be converted to XML. By default, there is no set maximum.

SETMETAHEADER.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setmetaheader
SETMETAHEADER.descriptionText: Sets the XML meta header. When set, the header is inserted at the beginning of the metadata part (DTD or XMLSchema) of each XML document generated by this object. The last meta header specified is used. Passing in NULL for the header parameter unsets the meta header.

SETNULLATTRIBUTEINDICATOR.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setnullattributeindicator
SETNULLATTRIBUTEINDICATOR.descriptionText: Specifies whether to use an XML attribute to indicate NULLness, or to do this by omitting the particular entity in the XML document.

SETRAISEEXCEPTION.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setraiseexception
SETRAISEEXCEPTION.descriptionText: Specifies whether to throw raised exceptions. If this call is\'t made or if FALSE is passed to the flag argument, the XSU catches the SQL exceptions and generates an XML document from the exception message.

SETRAISENOROWSEXCEPTION.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setraisenorowsexception
SETRAISENOROWSEXCEPTION.descriptionText: Specifies whether to throw an OracleXMLNoRowsException when the generated XML document is empty. By default, the exception is not thrown.

SETROWIDATTRNAME.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowidattrname
SETROWIDATTRNAME.descriptionText: Sets the name of the id attribute of the row enclosing tag. Passing NULL or an empty string for the tag causes the row id attribute to be omitted.

SETROWIDATTRVALUE.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowidattrvalue
SETROWIDATTRVALUE.descriptionText: Specifies the scalar column whose value is to be assigned to the id attribute of the row enclosing tag. Passing NULL or an empty string for the colName assigns the row count value (0, 1, 2 and so on) to the row id attribute.

SETROWSETTAG.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowsettag
SETROWSETTAG.descriptionText: Sets the tag to be used to enclose the XML dataset.

SETROWTAG.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowtag
SETROWTAG.descriptionText: Sets the tag to be used to enclose the XML element corresponding to a db.record.

SETSKIPROWS.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setskiprows
SETSKIPROWS.descriptionText: Sets the number of rows to skip. By default, 0 rows are skipped.

SETSQLTOXMLNAMEESCAPING.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setsqltoxmlnameescaping
SETSQLTOXMLNAMEESCAPING.descriptionText: This turns on or off escaping of XML tags in the case that the SQL object name, which is mapped to a XML identifier, is not a valid XML identifier.

SETSTYLESHEETHEADER.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setstylesheetheader
SETSTYLESHEETHEADER.bodyFullText:
SETSTYLESHEETHEADER(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
uri IN VARCHAR2,
type IN VARCHAR2 := 'text/xsl');
SETSTYLESHEETHEADER.descriptionText: Sets the stylesheet header (the stylesheet processing instructions) in the generated XML document. Passing NULL for the uri argument will unset the stylesheet header and the stylesheet type.

SETTAGCASE.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.settagcase
SETTAGCASE.descriptionText: Specifies the case of the generated XML tags.

SETXSLTPARAM.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setxsltparam
SETXSLTPARAM.bodyFullText:
SETXSLTPARAM(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
name IN VARCHAR2,
value IN VARCHAR2);
SETXSLTPARAM.descriptionText: Sets the value of a top-level stylesheet parameter. The parameter value is expected to be a valid XPath expression; the string literal values would therefore have to be quoted explicitly. If no stylesheet is registered, this method is not operational.

USETYPEFORCOLLELEMTAG.name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.usetypeforcollelemtag
USETYPEFORCOLLELEMTAG.descriptionText: Specifies whether to use the collection elemen\'s type name as its element tag name. By default, the tag name for elements of a collection is the collectio\'s tag name followed by _item.

NEWCONTEXT.name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.newcontext
NEWCONTEXT.descriptionText: Creates a save context, and returns the context handle.

SETBATCHSIZE.name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setbatchsize
SETBATCHSIZE.descriptionText: Changes the batch size used during DML operations. When performing inserts, updates or deletes, it is better to batch the operations so that they get executed in one shot rather than as separate statements. The flip side is that more memory is needed to buffer all the bind values. Note that when batching is used, a commit occurs only after a batch is executed. So if one of the statement inside a batch fails, the whole batch is rolled back. This is a small price to pay considering the performance gain; nevertheless, if this behavior is unacceptable, then set the batch size to 1.

SETCOMMITBATCH.name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setcommitbatch
SETCOMMITBATCH.descriptionText: Sets the commit batch size. The commit batch size refers to the number or records inserted after which a commit should follow. If batchSize is less than 1 or the session is in "auto-commit" mode, using the XSU does not make any explicit commits. By default, commitBatch is 0.

SETIGNORECASE.name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setignorecase
SETIGNORECASE.descriptionText: The XSU does mapping of XML elements to db columns/attributes based on the element names (XML tags). This function tells the XSU to do this match case insensitive.

SETKEYCOLUMN.name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setkeycolumn
SETKEYCOLUMN.descriptionText: This method adds a column to the "key column list". The value for the column cannot be NULL. In case of update or delete, the columns in the key column list make up the WHERE clause of the statement. The key columns list must be specified before updates can complete; this is optional for delete operations.

SETUPDATECOLUMN.name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setupdatecolumn
SETUPDATECOLUMN.descriptionText: Adds a column to the update column list. In case of insert, the default is to insert values to all the columns in the table; on the other hand, in case of updates, the default is to only update the columns corresponding to the tags present in the ROW element of the XML document. When the update column list is specified, the columns making up this list alone will get updated or inserted into.

COMPILESCHEMA.name: dbms_xmlschema.compileschema
COMPILESCHEMA.descriptionText: This procedure can be used to re-compile an already registered XML schema. This is useful for bringing a schema in an invalid state to a valid state. Can result in a ORA-31001 exception: invalid resource handle or path name.

COPYEVOLVE.name: dbms_xmlschema.copyevolve
COPYEVOLVE.body:
schemaurls => $1
	, newschemas => $2
	, transforms => $3
	, preserveolddocs => $4
	, maptablename => $5
	, generatetables => $6
	, force => $7
	, schemaowners => 0
	, options => 0
COPYEVOLVE.bodyNoDefault:
schemaurls => $1
	, newschemas => $2
	, transforms => $3
	, preserveolddocs => $4
	, maptablename => $5
	, generatetables => $6
	, force => $7
	, schemaowners => $8
	, options => $9
COPYEVOLVE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA.COPYEVOLVE(
   schemaurls       IN  XDB$STRUBG_LIST_T,
   newschemas       IN  XMLSequenceType,
   transforms       IN  XMLSequenceType :=NULL,
   preserveolddocs  IN  BOOLEAN :=FALSE,
   maptablename     IN  VARCHAR2 :=NULL,
   generatetables   IN  BOOLEAN :=TRUE,
   force            IN  BOOLEAN :=FALSE,
   schemaowners     IN  XDB$STRING_LIST_T :=NULL
   parallelDegree   IN  PLS_INTEGER := 0,
   options          IN  PLS_INTEGER := 0);
COPYEVOLVE.descriptionText: This procedure evolves registered schemas so that existing XML instances remain valid.

DELETESCHEMA.name: dbms_xmlschema.deleteschema
DELETESCHEMA.descriptionText: This procedure deletes the XML Schema specified by the URL.

GENERATESCHEMA.name: dbms_xmlschema.generateschema
GENERATESCHEMA.body:
schemaname => $1
	, typename => $2
	, elementname => NULL
	, recurse => TRUE
	, annotate => TRUE

ADDXDBNAMESPACE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.addxdbnamespace
ADDXDBNAMESPACE.descriptionText: This procedure adds the XDB namespace required for XDB annotation.

DISABLEDEFAULTTABLECREATION.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.disabledefaulttablecreation
DISABLEDEFAULTTABLECREATION.descriptionText: This procedure prevents the creation of a table for the top-level element by adding a default table attribute with an empty value to the element. The first overload applies to a specified top-level element and the second applies to all top-level elements. The procedure always overwrites. This is equivalent to using the schema annotation xdb:defaultTable="" for the top-level element or elements.

DISABLEMAINTAINDOM.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.disablemaintaindom
DISABLEMAINTAINDOM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.DISABLEMAINTAINDOM (
   xmlschema       IN OUT XMLType, 
   overwrite       IN BOOLEAN default TRUE);
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.DISABLEMAINTAINDOM (
   xmlschema       IN OUT XMLType, 
   complexTypeName IN VARCHAR2,  
   overwrite       IN BOOLEAN default TRUE);
DISABLEMAINTAINDOM.descriptionText: This procedure sets the DOM fidelity attribute to FALSE.

ENABLEDEFAULTTABLECREATION.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.enabledefaulttablecreation
ENABLEDEFAULTTABLECREATION.descriptionText: This procedure enables the creation of ALL top level tables by removing the empty default table name annotation.

ENABLEMAINTAINDOM.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.enablemaintaindom
ENABLEMAINTAINDOM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.ENABLEMAINTAINDOM (
   xmlschema       IN OUT XMLType, 
   overwrite       IN BOOLEAN default TRUE);
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.ENABLEMAINTAINDOM (
   xmlschema        IN OUT XMLType, 
   complexTypeName  IN VARCHAR2,  
   overwrite        IN BOOLEAN default TRUE);
ENABLEMAINTAINDOM.descriptionText: This procedure sets the DOM fidelity attribute to TRUE.

GETSCHEMAANNOTATIONS.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.getschemaannotations
GETSCHEMAANNOTATIONS.descriptionText: This function creates a document containing the differences between the annotated XML schema and the original XML schema.

GETSIDXDEFFROMVIEW.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.getsidxdeffromview
GETSIDXDEFFROMVIEW.descriptionText: This function takes a XMLTABLE view definition on a xmltype column or table and it returns a CLOB which can be used as parameter to create a structured xmlindex that backs up the XMLTABLE view as relational table.

PRINTWARNINGS.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.printwarnings
PRINTWARNINGS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.PRINTWARNINGS (
   value       IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
PRINTWARNINGS.descriptionText: This procedure lets a user raise or suppress a warning if an annotation maps to zero nodes in the XML schema.

REMOVEANYSTORAGE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removeanystorage
REMOVEANYSTORAGE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the setting of the SQL type from the ANY child of the complex type with the given name.

REMOVEDEFAULTTABLE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removedefaulttable
REMOVEDEFAULTTABLE.descriptionText: This procedure removes any default table attribute given for the element. After calling this procedure, the system generates table names. This procedure always overwrites.

REMOVEMAINTAINDOM.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removemaintaindom
REMOVEMAINTAINDOM.descriptionText: This procedure removes all annotations used to maintain DOM from the given schema.

REMOVEOUTOFLINE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removeoutofline
REMOVEOUTOFLINE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.REMOVEOUTOFLINE (
   xmlschema           IN OUT  XMLType, 
   elementName         IN      VARCHAR2, 
   elementType         IN      VARCHAR2, 
   overwrite           IN      BOOLEAN default TRUE);
REMOVEOUTOFLINE.descriptionText: This procedure removes any existing SQLInline attributes to prevent out-of-line storage. There are three overloads.

REMOVESQLCOLLTYPE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removesqlcolltype
REMOVESQLCOLLTYPE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.REMOVESQLCOLLTYPE (
   xmlschema   IN OUT XMLType, 
   elementName IN VARCHAR2);
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.REMOVESQLCOLLTYPE (

   globalObject     IN VARCHAR2, 
   globalName       IN VARCHAR2, 
   localElementName IN VARCHAR2);
REMOVESQLCOLLTYPE.descriptionText: This procedure removes a SQL collection type. The first overload removes the SQL collection type corresponding to the named element and the second overload removes the type from the XML element inside the complex type.

DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.REMOVESQLTYPE (

REMOVESQLTYPE.descriptionText: This procedure removes a SQL type. The first overload removes a SQL type from a global element and the second overload removes the type from a global element inside the complex type.

REMOVESQLTYPEMAPPING.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removesqltypemapping
REMOVESQLTYPEMAPPING.descriptionText: This procedure removes the SQL type mapping for the given schema type.

REMOVETABLEPROPS.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removetableprops
REMOVETABLEPROPS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.REMOVETABLEPROPS (
   xmlschema            IN OUT  XMLTYPE,
   globalElementName    IN      VARCHAR2);
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.REMOVETABLEPROPS (
   xmlschema            IN OUT  XMLTYPE, 
   globalObject         IN      VARCHAR2, 
   globalObjectName     IN      VARCHAR2, 
   localElementName     IN      VARCHAR2);
REMOVETABLEPROPS.descriptionText: This procedure removes the table storage properties from the CREATE TABLE statement. This procedure is overloaded. Each overload has different parameter requirements as indicated.

REMOVETIMESTAMPWITHTIMEZONE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.removetimestampwithtimezone
REMOVETIMESTAMPWITHTIMEZONE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the setting of the TimeStampWithTimeZone datatype from all dateTime typed elements in the XML schema.

DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.SETANYSTORAGE )
   xmlschema       IN OUT  XMLType,
   complexTypeName IN      VARCHAR2,
   sqlTypeName     IN      VARCHAR2, 
   overwrite       IN      BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
SETANYSTORAGE.descriptionText: This procedure assigns a SQL datatype to the ANY child of the complex type with the given name.

SETDEFAULTTABLE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.setdefaulttable
SETDEFAULTTABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.SETDEFAULTTABLE (
   xmlschema           IN  OUT  XMLTYPE,
   globalElementName   IN       VARCHAR2, 
   tableName           IN       VARCHAR2,

SETDEFAULTTABLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the table for the specified global element. This is equivalent to using the schema annotation xdb:defaultTable="<default_table_name>" for the top-level element.

   elementName        IN      VARCHAR2, 
   elementType        IN      VARCHAR2, 
   defaultTableName   IN      VARCHAR2, 
   overwrite          IN      BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
SETOUTOFLINE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the SQLInline attribute to FALSE, that is, it sets xdb:SQLInLine=FALSE.

SETSCHEMAANNOTATIONS.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.setschemaannotations
SETSCHEMAANNOTATIONS.descriptionText: This procedure takes the annotated differences resulting from a call to DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.GETSCHEMAANNOTATIONS and patches them into the provided XML schema.

xmlschema => $1

DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.SETSQLTYPE (

SETSQLTYPEMAPPING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.SETSQLTYPEMAPPING (
   xmlschema         IN OUT   XMLType,

SETTABLEPROPS.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.settableprops
SETTABLEPROPS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.SETTABLEPROPS (
   xmlschema            IN OUT  XMLType, 
   globalElementName    IN      VARCHAR2, 
   tableProps           IN      VARCHAR2,    
   overwrite            IN      BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
DBMS_XMLSCHEMA_ANNOTATE.SETTABLEPROPS (
   xmlschema            IN OUT  XMLTYPE,
   globalObject         IN      VARCHAR2, 
   globalObjectName     IN      VARCHAR2, 
   localElementName     IN      VARCHAR2, 
   tableProps           IN      VARCHAR2, 
   overwrite            IN      BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
SETTABLEPROPS.descriptionText: This procedure specifies properties in the TABLE storage clause that is appended to the default CREATE TABLE statement. There are two overloads with different parameter requirements, as indicated:

SETTIMESTAMPWITHTIMEZONE.name: dbms_xmlschema_annotate.settimestampwithtimezone
SETTIMESTAMPWITHTIMEZONE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the TIMESTAMPWITHTIMEZONE datatype to all dateTime typed elements in the XML schema. This is equivalent to adding xdb:SQLType="TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE" to all dateTime objects.

DISABLEINDEXESANDCONSTRAINTS.name: dbms_xmlstorage_manage.disableindexesandconstraints

	, table_name => $1
	, column_name => NULL
	, clear => FALSE

DBMS_XMLSTORAGE_MANAGE.DISABLEINDEXESANDCONSTRAINTS (
   owner_name    IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT USER, 
   table_name    IN  VARCHAR2, 
   column_name   IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   clear         IN  BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE);
DISABLEINDEXESANDCONSTRAINTS.descriptionText: This procedure disables the indexes and constraints for XMLType tables and XMLType columns.

ENABLEINDEXESANDCONSTRAINTS.name: dbms_xmlstorage_manage.enableindexesandconstraints
ENABLEINDEXESANDCONSTRAINTS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSTORAGE_MANAGE.ENABLEINDEXESANDCONSTRAINTS (
   owner_name   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT USER, 
   table_name   IN VARCHAR2, 
   column_name  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);

EXCHANGEPREPROC.name: dbms_xmlstorage_manage.exchangepreproc
EXCHANGEPREPROC.descriptionText: This procedure disable constraints before exchange partition.

owner_name => USER

	, column_name => NULL

XPATH2TABCOLMAPPING.name: dbms_xmlstorage_manage.xpath2tabcolmapping

owner_name => USER
	, table_name => $1
	, column_name => NULL
	, xpath => $2
	, namespaces => NULL
XPATH2TABCOLMAPPING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLSTORAGE_MANAGE.XPATH2TABCOLMAPPING (
   owner_name   IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT USER, 
   table_name   IN  VARCHAR2,
   column_name  IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   xpath        IN  VARCHAR2,
   namespaces   IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN XMLTYPE;
XPATH2TABCOLMAPPING.descriptionText: This function maps a path expression (in XPath notation or DOT notations) to the corresponding table name and column name. This is necessary in cases in which the user wants to create an index on this table, or to add a constraint, or to rename a table to make query execution plans more readable.

	, plan_hash_value => NULL
	, db_id => NULL
	, format => TYPICAL

RECOVER_OPERATION.name: dbms_xstream_adm.recover_operation
RECOVER_OPERATION.descriptionText: This procedure provides options for split and merge operations that stopped because they encountered an errors. This procedure either rolls forward the operation, rolls back the operation, or purges all of the metadata about the operation. Split and merge operations might be run in an XStream Out environment in which multiple outbound servers use the same capture process.

propagation_name => $1
	, cloned_propagation_name => NULL
	, cloned_queue_name => NULL
	, cloned_capture_name => NULL
	, perform_actions => TRUE
	, script_name => NULL
	, script_directory_object => NULL
	, auto_merge_threshold => NULL
	, schedule_name => $2
	, merge_job_name => $3
SPLIT_STREAMS.bodyNoDefault:
propagation_name => $1
	, cloned_propagation_name => $2
	, cloned_queue_name => $3
	, cloned_capture_name => $4
	, perform_actions => $5
	, script_name => $6
	, script_directory_object => $7
	, auto_merge_threshold => $8
	, schedule_name => $9
	, merge_job_name => $10
SPLIT_STREAMS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSTREAM_ADM.SPLIT_STREAMS(
   propagation_name         IN      VARCHAR2,
   cloned_propagation_name  IN      VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   cloned_queue_name        IN      VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   cloned_capture_name      IN      VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   perform_actions          IN      BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   script_name              IN      VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   script_directory_object  IN      VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   auto_merge_threshold     IN      NUMBER    DEFAULT NULL,
   schedule_name            IN OUT  VARCHAR2,
   merge_job_name           IN OUT  VARCHAR2);
SPLIT_STREAMS.descriptionText: This procedure splits one stream flowing from a capture process off from all of the other streams flowing from the capture process.

START_OUTBOUND.name: dbms_xstream_adm.start_outbound
START_OUTBOUND.descriptionText: This procedure starts an XStream outbound server. The outbound server streams out the LCRs to an XStream client application.

STOP_OUTBOUND.name: dbms_xstream_adm.stop_outbound
STOP_OUTBOUND.descriptionText: This procedure stops an XStream outbound server. The outbound server streams out the LCRs to an XStream client application.

GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.name: dbms_xstream_auth.grant_admin_privilege

grantee => $1
	, privilege_type => '*'
	, grant_select_privileges => FALSE
	, do_grants => TRUE
	, file_name => NULL
	, directory_name => NULL
	, grant_optional_privileges => NULL
	, container => 'CURRENT'
GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyNoDefault:
grantee => $1
	, privilege_type => $2
	, grant_select_privileges => $3
	, do_grants => $4
	, file_name => $5
	, directory_name => $6
	, grant_optional_privileges => $7
	, container => $8
GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSTREAM_AUTH.GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE(
   grantee                    IN  VARCHAR2,
   privilege_type             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT '*',
   grant_select_privileges    IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   do_grants                  IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   file_name                  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   directory_name             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL
   grant_optional_privileges  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   container                  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'CURRENT');
GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure either grants the privileges needed by a user to be an XStream administrator directly, or generates a script that grants these privileges.

GRANT_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.name: dbms_xstream_auth.grant_remote_admin_access
GRANT_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure enables a remote XStream administrator to perform administrative actions at the local database by connecting to the grantee using a database link.

REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.name: dbms_xstream_auth.revoke_admin_privilege
REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.body:
grantee => $1
	, privilege_type => '*'
	, revoke_select_privileges => FALSE
	, do_revokes => TRUE
	, file_name => NULL
	, directory_name => NULL
	, revoke_optional_privileges => NULL
	, container => 'CURRENT'
REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyNoDefault:
grantee => $1
	, privilege_type => $2
	, revoke_select_privileges => $3
	, do_revokes => $4
	, file_name => $5
	, directory_name => $6
	, revoke_optional_privileges => $7
	, container => $8
REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSTREAM_AUTH.REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE(
   grantee                     IN  VARCHAR2,  
   privilege_type              IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT '*',
   revoke_select_privileges    IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   do_revokes                  IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   file_name                   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   directory_name              IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL
   revoke_optional_privileges  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   container                   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'CURRENT');
REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure either revokes XStream administrator privileges from a user directly, or generates a script that revokes these privileges.

REVOKE_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.name: dbms_xstream_auth.revoke_remote_admin_access
REVOKE_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure disables a remote XStream administrator from performing administrative actions by connecting to the grantee using a database link.

STARTUP_EXTPROC_AGENT.name: debug_extproc.startup_extproc_agent
STARTUP_EXTPROC_AGENT.descriptionText: This procedure starts up the extproc agent process in the session.This enables you to get the PID of the executing process. This PID is needed to be able to attach to the running process using a debugger.

ADDRESS.name: htf.address

   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
ADDRESS.descriptionText: This function generates the <ADDRESS> and </ADDRESS> tags which specify the address, author and signature of a document.

	, ctext => $2

   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
ANCHOR.descriptionText: This function and the ANCHOR2 Function functions generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that the ANCHOR2 Function provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

 RETURN VARCHAR2;
ANCHOR2.descriptionText: This function and the ANCHOR Function generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that this functions provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

APPLETCLOSE.name: htf.appletclose
APPLETCLOSE.descriptionText: This function closes the applet invocation with the </APPLET> tag. You must first invoke the a Java applet using APPLETOPEN Function

APPLETOPEN.name: htf.appletopen

HTF.APPLETOPEN (
   ccode          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cheight        IN       NUMBER,
   cwidth         IN       NUMBER,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
APPLETOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <APPLET> tag which begins the invocation of a Java applet. You close the applet invocation with APPLETCLOSE Function which generates the </APPLET> tag.

  RETURN VARCHAR2;
AREA.descriptionText: This function generates the <AREA> tag, which defines a client-side image map. The <AREA> tag defines areas within the image and destinations for the areas.

BASE.name: htf.base
BASE.bodyFullText:
HTF.BASE (
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BASE.descriptionText: This function generates the <BASE> tag which records the URL of the document.

BASEFONT.name: htf.basefont
BASEFONT.descriptionText: This function generates the <BASEFONT> tag which specifies the base font size for a Web page.

BGSOUND.name: htf.bgsound

   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cloop          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;

BIG.name: htf.big
BIG.bodyFullText:
HTF.BIG (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BIG.descriptionText: This function generates the <BIG> and </BIG> tags which direct the browser to render the text in a bigger font.

BLOCKQUOTECLOSE.name: htf.blockquoteclose
BLOCKQUOTECLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the tag which mark the end of a section of quoted text. You mark the beginning of a section of text by means of the BLOCKQUOTEOPEN Function.

BLOCKQUOTEOPEN.name: htf.blockquoteopen
BLOCKQUOTEOPEN.body:
cnowrap => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
