AUTH.bodyFullText:
UTL_SMTP.AUTH (
   c          IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   username   IN            VARCHAR2,
   password   IN            VARCHAR2,
   schemes    IN            VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NON_CLEARTEXT_PASSWORD_SCHEMES)
 RETURN reply;

UTL_SMTP.AUTH (
   c          IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   username   IN            VARCHAR2,
   password   IN            VARCHAR2,
   schemes    IN            VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NON_CLEARTEXT_PASSWORD_SCHEMES);
AUTH.descriptionText: This subprogram sends the AUTH command to authenticate to the SMTP server. The UTL_SMTP package goes through the use\'s choices of authentication schemes, skips any that is not supported by the SMTP server and uses the first supported. To determine the schemes the SMTP server supports from its EHLO reply, the user must call the EHLO Function and Procedure. Otherwise, UTL_SMTP uses the first scheme in the list.

CLOSE_CONNECTION.name: utl_smtp.close_connection
CLOSE_CONNECTION.bodyFullText:
UTL_SMTP.CLOSE_CONNECTION (
   c     IN OUT NOCOPY connection);
CLOSE_CONNECTION.descriptionText: This procedure closes the SMTP connection, causing the current SMTP operation to terminate. Use this procedure only to cancel an e-mail in the middle of the data session. To end the SMTP connection properly, use the QUIT Function and Procedure.

CLOSE_DATA.name: utl_smtp.close_data
CLOSE_DATA.descriptionText: This subprogram ends the e-mail message by sending the sequence <CR><LF>.<CR><LF> (a single period at the beginning of a line).

COMMAND.name: utl_smtp.command
COMMAND.bodyFullText:
UTL_SMTP.COMMAND (
   c     IN OUT NOCOPY    connection,
   cmd   IN               VARCHAR2,
   arg   IN               VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN reply;

UTL_SMTP.COMMAND (
   c     IN OUT NOCOPY    connection,
   cmd   IN               VARCHAR2,
   arg   IN               VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
COMMAND.descriptionText: This subprogram performs a generic SMTP command.

COMMAND_REPLIES.name: utl_smtp.command_replies

UTL_SMTP.COMMAND_REPLIES (
   c     IN OUT NOCOPY    connection,

   arg   IN               VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN replies;
COMMAND_REPLIES.descriptionText: This function performs a generic SMTP command and retrieves multiple reply lines.

NOOP.name: utl_smtp.noop

	, port => 25
	, c => $2
	, tx_timeout => NULL
	, wallet_path => NULL
	, wallet_password => NULL
	, secure_connection_before_smtp => FALSE

host => $1
	, port => $2
	, c => $3
	, tx_timeout => $4
	, wallet_path => $5
	, wallet_password => $6

OPEN_CONNECTION.bodyFullText:
UTL_SMTP.OPEN_CONNECTION (
   host                            IN  VARCHAR2, 
   port                            IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 25, 
   c                               OUT connection, 
   tx_timeout                      IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   wallet_path                     IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   wallet_password                 IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   secure_connection_before_smtp   IN  BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE)
 RETURN reply; 

UTL_SMTP.OPEN_CONNECTION (
   host                           IN  VARCHAR2, 
   port                           IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 25, 
   tx_timeout                     IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   wallet_path                    IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   wallet_password                IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   secure_connection_before_smtp  IN  BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE) 
RETURN connection;
OPEN_CONNECTION.descriptionText: These functions open a connection to an SMTP server.

OPEN_DATA.name: utl_smtp.open_data
OPEN_DATA.descriptionText: This subprogram sends the DATA command after which you can use WRITE_DATA and WRITE_RAW_DATA to write a portion of the e-mail message.

QUIT.name: utl_smtp.quit
QUIT.descriptionText: This subprogram terminates an SMTP session and disconnects from the server.

RCPT.name: utl_smtp.rcpt
RCPT.bodyFullText:
UTL_SMTP.RCPT (
   c           IN OUT NOCOPY     connection,
   recipient   IN                VARCHAR2,

RETURN reply;

UTL_SMTP.RCPT (
   c           IN OUT NOCOPY     connection,
   recipient   IN                VARCHAR2,
   parameters  IN                VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
RCPT.descriptionText: This subprogram specifies the recipient of an e-mail message.

RSET.name: utl_smtp.rset
RSET.descriptionText: This subprogram terminates the current mail transaction.

STARTTLS.name: utl_smtp.starttls
STARTTLS.descriptionText: This subprogram sends the STARTTLS command to secure the SMTP connection using SSL/TLS. SSL/TLS requires an Oracle wallet which must be specified when the connection was opened by the OPEN_CONNECTION Functions.

VRFY.name: utl_smtp.vrfy
VRFY.bodyFullText:
UTL_SMTP.VRFY (
   c          IN OUT NOCOPY connection
   recipient  IN VARCHAR2) 
RETURN reply;
VRFY.descriptionText: This function verifies the validity of a destination e-mail address.

WRITE_DATA.name: utl_smtp.write_data
WRITE_DATA.descriptionText: This procedure writes a portion of the e-mail message. A repeat call to WRITE_DATA appends data to the e-mail message.

WRITE_RAW_DATA.name: utl_smtp.write_raw_data
WRITE_RAW_DATA.descriptionText: This procedure writes a portion of the e-mail message. A repeat call to WRITE_RAW_DATA appends data to the e-mail message.

RETURN BOOLEAN;
IS_MONITORING.descriptionText: This function checks whether a monitoring job is currently running. This function either returns TRUE if a monitoring job is currently running or FALSE if a monitoring job is not currently running.

AVAILABLE.name: utl_tcp.available
AVAILABLE.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.AVAILABLE (
   c        IN OUT NOCOPY connection, 
   timeout  IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 0)
RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
AVAILABLE.descriptionText: This function determines the number of bytes available for reading from a TCP/IP connection. It is the number of bytes that can be read immediately without blocking. Determines if data is ready to be read from the connection.

CLOSE_ALL_CONNECTIONS.name: utl_tcp.close_all_connections
CLOSE_ALL_CONNECTIONS.descriptionText: This procedure closes all open TCP/IP connections.

UTL_TCP.CLOSE_CONNECTION (

FLUSH.name: utl_tcp.flush
FLUSH.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.FLUSH (
   c IN OUT NOCOPY connection);
FLUSH.descriptionText: This procedure transfers immediately to the server all data in the output buffer, if a buffer is used.

GET_LINE.name: utl_tcp.get_line

UTL_TCP.GET_LINE (

	, RETURN => $3
OPEN_CONNECTION.bodyNoDefault:
remote_host => $1
	, remote_port => $2
	, local_host => $3
	, local_port => $4

	, out_buffer_size => $6

	, RETURN => $12
OPEN_CONNECTION.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.OPEN_CONNECTION  (
   remote_host          IN VARCHAR2,
   remote_port          IN PLS_INTEGER,
   local_host           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   local_port           IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   in_buffer_size       IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,

   wallet_path          IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   wallet_password      IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
  RETURN connection;
OPEN_CONNECTION.descriptionText: This function opens a TCP/IP connection to a specified service.

READ_LINE.name: utl_tcp.read_line
READ_LINE.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.READ_LINE (
   c           IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   data        IN OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   peek        IN            BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE) 
 RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
READ_LINE.descriptionText: This function receives a text line from a service on an open connection. A line is terminated by a line-feed, a carriage-return or a carriage-return followed by a line-feed.

READ_RAW.name: utl_tcp.read_raw
READ_RAW.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.READ_RAW (
   c     IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   data  IN OUT NOCOPY RAW,
   len   IN            PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   peek  IN            BOOLEAN     DEFAULT FALSE)
 RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
READ_RAW.descriptionText: This function receives binary data from a service on an open connection.

READ_TEXT.name: utl_tcp.read_text
READ_TEXT.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.READ_TEXT (
   c    IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   data IN OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   len  IN            PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   peek IN            BOOLEAN     DEFAULT FALSE) 
RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
READ_TEXT.descriptionText: This function receives text data from a service on an open connection.

SECURE_CONNECTION.name: utl_tcp.secure_connection
SECURE_CONNECTION.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.SECURE_CONNECTION (
   c    IN OUT NOCOPY connection);
SECURE_CONNECTION.descriptionText: This procedure secures a TCP/IP connection using SSL/TLS. SSL/TLS requires an Oracle wallet which must be specified when the connection was opened by the OPEN_CONNECTION Function.

WRITE_LINE.name: utl_tcp.write_line
WRITE_LINE.body:
c => $1
	, data => NULL CHARACTER SET ANY_CS
WRITE_LINE.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.WRITE_LINE (
   c    IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   data IN            VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL CHARACTER SET ANY_CS) 
  RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
WRITE_LINE.descriptionText: This function transmits a text line to a service on an open connection. The newline character sequence is appended to the message before it is transmitted.

WRITE_RAW.name: utl_tcp.write_raw
WRITE_RAW.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.WRITE_RAW (
   c    IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   data IN            RAW,
   len  IN            PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
 RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
WRITE_RAW.descriptionText: This function transmits a binary message to a service on an open connection. The function does not return until the specified number of bytes have been written.

WRITE_TEXT.name: utl_tcp.write_text
WRITE_TEXT.bodyFullText:
UTL_TCP.WRITE_TEXT (
   c    IN OUT NOCOPY connection,
   data IN            VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   len  IN            PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
 RETURN num_chars PLS_INTEGER;
WRITE_TEXT.descriptionText: This function transmits a text message to a service on an open connection.

UNESCAPE.name: utl_url.unescape

UNESCAPE.descriptionText: This function unescapes the escape character sequences to its original form in a URL, to convert the %XX escape character sequences to the original characters.
